Tester Feedback:
Execution partially failed - The code successfully accessed 2 out of 3 Wikipedia sources and downloaded valuable content (270KB and 306KB HTML files), but encountered a critical NameError: 'context' is not defined when processing church-related keywords. The search also appears to have been interrupted during Step 2 (only 3 of 5 DuckDuckGo searches completed). **PLAN** alignment: ~40% complete - data collection started but keyword extraction failed due to the undefined 'context' variable on line 86. The code found relevant church keywords ('priest', 'relief', 'aid') in the Wikipedia pages but couldn't extract the actual text sections due to the error. Immediate fix needed: Define the 'context' variable properly in the church keyword extraction section, then re-run to complete all search steps and analyze the downloaded content for Archbishop identification.
Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime import os import re print('=== SEARCHING FOR ARCHBISHOP WHO LED 1985 NEVADO DEL RUIZ DISASTER RELIEF ===') print('Objective: Identify Catholic Church leadership in Armero tragedy response') print('Date: November 13, 1985 - Nevado del Ruiz volcanic eruption') print('Location: Armero, Colombia') print('Casualties: Over 23,000 people killed') print('=' * 80) # Create workspace directory workspace_dir = 'workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) # Request headers to avoid blocking headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print('\n=== STEP 1: WIKIPEDIA SEARCH FOR NEVADO DEL RUIZ ERUPTION ===\n') # Search Wikipedia for the 1985 Nevado del Ruiz eruption wikipedia_urls = [ 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1985_Nevado_del_Ruiz_eruption', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armero_tragedy', 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nevado_del_Ruiz' ] eruption_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_queries': [], 'wikipedia_sources': [], 'archbishop_mentions': [], 'church_response_details': [], 'relief_coordination_info': [] } for i, url in enumerate(wikipedia_urls, 1): print(f'{i}. Accessing Wikipedia: {url}') try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: print(f' ✅ Successfully accessed (Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes)') soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') page_title = soup.find('title') print(f' Page title: {page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else "Unknown"}') # Save the HTML for analysis filename = f'nevado_ruiz_wiki_{i}.html' filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f' 📁 Saved to: {filename}') # Store source info source_info = { 'url': url, 'title': page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else 'Unknown', 'filename': filename, 'content_length': len(response.content) } eruption_data['wikipedia_sources'].append(source_info) # Look for archbishop and church-related keywords page_text = soup.get_text().lower() church_keywords = ['archbishop', 'bishop', 'cardinal', 'catholic', 'church', 'priest', 'relief', 'aid', 'disaster response'] found_keywords = [] for keyword in church_keywords: if keyword in page_text: found_keywords.append(keyword) if found_keywords: print(f' 🎯 Found church-related keywords: {found_keywords}') # Extract relevant sections mentioning church response church_sections = [] for element in soup.find_all(text=re.compile(r'archbishop|bishop|cardinal|catholic|church|priest|relief|aid', re.IGNORECASE)): parent = element.parent if parent: context = parent.get_text().strip() if len(context) > 50 and any(kw in context.lower() for kw in ['archbishop', 'bishop', 'cardinal', 'catholic church']): church_sections.append(context) if church_sections: print(f' Found {len(church_sections)} relevant church sections:') for j, section in enumerate(church_sections[:3], 1): print(f' Section {j}: {section[:200]}...' if len(section) > 200 else f' Section {j}: {section}') eruption_data['church_response_details'].append({ 'source': url, 'section': section[:500], 'keywords_found': found_keywords }) print() else: print(f' ❌ No church-related keywords found') elif response.status_code == 404: print(f' ❌ Page not found (404)') else: print(f' ❌ HTTP error: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error accessing URL: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print('\n=== STEP 2: TARGETED SEARCH FOR COLOMBIAN ARCHBISHOP 1985 ===\n') # Search for specific information about Colombian Catholic Church response search_queries = [ 'Colombian Archbishop 1985 Nevado del Ruiz disaster relief', 'Catholic Church response Armero tragedy 1985 Colombia', 'Archbishop disaster relief coordination Colombia 1985', 'Bogota Archbishop 1985 volcanic eruption response', 'Cardinal Archbishop Colombia Nevado del Ruiz aid' ] for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'{i}. Searching for: "{query}"') try: # Use DuckDuckGo search API search_url = f'https://api.duckduckgo.com/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}&format=json&no_html=1&skip_disambig=1' response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: data = response.json() query_info = { 'query': query, 'results_found': False, 'abstract': '', 'related_topics': [] } # Check for instant answer if data.get('AbstractText'): print(f' ✅ Found abstract: {data["AbstractText"][:200]}...') query_info['abstract'] = data['AbstractText'] query_info['results_found'] = True # Look for archbishop mentions in abstract if 'archbishop' in data['AbstractText'].lower() or 'cardinal' in data['AbstractText'].lower(): eruption_data['archbishop_mentions'].append({ 'source': 'DuckDuckGo Abstract', 'query': query, 'text': data['AbstractText'], 'relevance': 'High - direct archbishop mention' }) print(' 🎯 Archbishop/Cardinal mentioned in abstract!') # Check for related topics if data.get('RelatedTopics'): print(f' ✅ Found {len(data["RelatedTopics"])} related topics') for j, topic in enumerate(data['RelatedTopics'][:3], 1): if isinstance(topic, dict) and 'Text' in topic: topic_text = topic['Text'] print(f' Topic {j}: {topic_text[:150]}...') query_info['related_topics'].append(topic_text) # Look for archbishop mentions in topics if 'archbishop' in topic_text.lower() or 'cardinal' in topic_text.lower(): eruption_data['archbishop_mentions'].append({ 'source': 'DuckDuckGo Related Topic', 'query': query, 'text': topic_text, 'relevance': 'Medium - related topic mention' }) print(' 🎯 Archbishop/Cardinal mentioned in related topic!') eruption_data['search_queries'].append(query_info) # Save search results search_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'duckduckgo_search_{i}.json') with open(search_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f' 📁 Search results saved to: {os.path.basename(search_file)}') else: print(f' ❌ Search API error: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Search error: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print('\n=== STEP 3: HISTORICAL SOURCES AND NEWS ARCHIVES ===\n') # Search historical sources and news archives historical_urls = [ 'https://www.britannica.com/event/Nevado-del-Ruiz-volcanic-disaster-of-1985', 'https://www.newadvent.org/cathen/', # Catholic Encyclopedia ] for i, url in enumerate(historical_urls, 1): print(f'{i}. Accessing historical source: {url}') try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: print(f' ✅ Successfully accessed') soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Save the page filename = f'historical_source_{i}.html' filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f' 📁 Saved to: {filename}') # Look for disaster and church mentions page_text = soup.get_text().lower() if 'nevado' in page_text or 'armero' in page_text or '1985' in page_text: print(f' 🎯 Found disaster-related content') # Extract relevant sections disaster_sections = [] for element in soup.find_all(text=re.compile(r'nevado|armero|1985|volcanic|disaster|colombia', re.IGNORECASE)): parent = element.parent if parent: context = parent.get_text().strip() if len(context) > 50: disaster_sections.append(context) if disaster_sections: print(f' Found {len(disaster_sections)} relevant sections:') for j, section in enumerate(disaster_sections[:2], 1): print(f' Section {j}: {section[:250]}...' if len(section) > 250 else f' Section {j}: {section}') # Check for church leadership mentions if any(term in section.lower() for term in ['archbishop', 'cardinal', 'bishop', 'church']): eruption_data['relief_coordination_info'].append({ 'source': url, 'section': section, 'type': 'Historical source with church mention' }) print() else: print(f' ❌ No disaster-related content found') else: print(f' ❌ HTTP error: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print('\n=== STEP 4: SPECIFIC COLOMBIAN CHURCH HIERARCHY SEARCH ===\n') # Search for specific Colombian Church hierarchy in 1985 columbian_church_queries = [ 'Archbishop of Bogota 1985 Colombia', 'Cardinal Mario Revollo Bravo Colombia 1985', 'Colombian Catholic Church hierarchy 1985', 'Archbishop disaster response Colombia volcanic eruption' ] for i, query in enumerate(columbian_church_queries, 1): print(f'{i}. Searching Colombian Church: "{query}"') try: search_url = f'https://api.duckduckgo.com/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}&format=json&no_html=1&skip_disambig=1' response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: data = response.json() # Check for instant answer if data.get('AbstractText'): abstract = data['AbstractText'] print(f' ✅ Found abstract: {abstract[:200]}...') # Look for specific names and titles if any(term in abstract.lower() for term in ['archbishop', 'cardinal', 'mario', 'revollo', 'bravo']): eruption_data['archbishop_mentions'].append({ 'source': 'Colombian Church Search', 'query': query, 'text': abstract, 'relevance': 'High - Colombian Church hierarchy' }) print(' 🎯 Colombian Church hierarchy information found!') # Check related topics if data.get('RelatedTopics'): for topic in data['RelatedTopics'][:3]: if isinstance(topic, dict) and 'Text' in topic: topic_text = topic['Text'] if any(term in topic_text.lower() for term in ['archbishop', 'cardinal', 'colombia', 'bogota']): eruption_data['archbishop_mentions'].append({ 'source': 'Colombian Church Related Topic', 'query': query, 'text': topic_text, 'relevance': 'Medium - related church topic' }) print(f' 🎯 Related topic: {topic_text[:100]}...') # Save Colombian church search results church_search_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'colombian_church_search_{i}.json') with open(church_search_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f' 📁 Colombian church search saved to: {os.path.basename(church_search_file)}') else: print(f' ❌ Search API error: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Search error: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print(f'\n=== INITIAL SEARCH COMPLETE ===\n') print(f'📁 All data saved to workspace directory: {workspace_dir}') print(f'🔍 Files created for analysis:') for filename in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Save comprehensive search results search_results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'nevado_ruiz_archbishop_search_{datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")}.json') with open(search_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(eruption_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n💾 Comprehensive search results saved to: {os.path.basename(search_results_file)}') # Summary of findings so far print(f'\n📊 SEARCH SUMMARY:') print(f' • Wikipedia sources accessed: {len(eruption_data["wikipedia_sources"])}') print(f' • Search queries executed: {len(eruption_data["search_queries"])}') print(f' • Archbishop mentions found: {len(eruption_data["archbishop_mentions"])}') print(f' • Church response details: {len(eruption_data["church_response_details"])}') print(f' • Relief coordination info: {len(eruption_data["relief_coordination_info"])}') if eruption_data['archbishop_mentions']: print(f'\n🎯 ARCHBISHOP MENTIONS PREVIEW:') for i, mention in enumerate(eruption_data['archbishop_mentions'][:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Source: {mention["source"]}') print(f' Relevance: {mention["relevance"]}') print(f' Text: {mention["text"][:150]}...') print() print(f'\n📋 Next step: Analyze saved HTML files and search results for specific Archbishop identification') print(f'🎯 Looking for: Name and role of Archbishop who led 1985 Nevado del Ruiz disaster relief efforts')

Accessing Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1985_Nevado_del_Ruiz_eruption ❌ Page not found (404) 2. Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime import re from bs4 import BeautifulSoup print('=== ANALYZING EXISTING NEVADO DEL RUIZ ARCHBISHOP SEARCH DATA ===') print('Objective: Inspect downloaded data and continue Archbishop identification') print('Focus: 1985 Colombian Catholic Church disaster relief leadership') print('=' * 80) # Check what files we have in workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f'\n📁 WORKSPACE FILES FOUND: {len(workspace_files)} files') for filename in sorted(workspace_files): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') else: print('❌ No workspace directory found') os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) print('✅ Created workspace directory') # Look for the main search results JSON file search_results_files = [f for f in workspace_files if 'nevado_ruiz_archbishop_search' in f and f.endswith('.json')] if search_results_files: # Use the most recent search results file results_file = max(search_results_files) results_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, results_file) print(f'\n🔍 ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS: {results_file}') # First, inspect the JSON structure safely print('\n=== JSON FILE STRUCTURE INSPECTION ===') with open(results_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f'Top-level keys: {list(search_data.keys())}') for key, value in search_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys') else: print(f' {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}...' if len(str(value)) > 100 else f' {key}: {value}') # Analyze archbishop mentions if they exist archbishop_mentions = search_data.get('archbishop_mentions', []) print(f'\n📋 ARCHBISHOP MENTIONS ANALYSIS: {len(archbishop_mentions)} found') if archbishop_mentions: for i, mention in enumerate(archbishop_mentions, 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {mention.get("source", "Unknown")}') print(f' Query: {mention.get("query", "N/A")}') print(f' Relevance: {mention.get("relevance", "N/A")}') print(f' Text: {mention.get("text", "")[:200]}...') else: print(' No archbishop mentions found in previous search') # Analyze church response details church_response = search_data.get('church_response_details', []) print(f'\n⛪ CHURCH RESPONSE DETAILS: {len(church_response)} found') for i, response in enumerate(church_response, 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {response.get("source", "Unknown")}') print(f' Keywords: {response.get("keywords_found", [])}') print(f' Section: {response.get("section", "")[:150]}...') else: print('\n❌ No main search results JSON file found') search_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'archbishop_mentions': [], 'church_response_details': [], 'wikipedia_sources': [] } print('\n=== ANALYZING DOWNLOADED WIKIPEDIA HTML FILES ===') # Analyze the Wikipedia HTML files that were successfully downloaded html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.startswith('nevado_ruiz_wiki_') and f.endswith('.html')] print(f'\nFound {len(html_files)} Wikipedia HTML files to analyze:') archbishop_findings = [] church_leadership_info = [] for html_file in html_files: print(f'\n🔍 ANALYZING: {html_file}') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') page_title = soup.find('title') print(f' Title: {page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else "Unknown"}') # Get full page text for analysis page_text = soup.get_text() page_text_lower = page_text.lower() print(f' Content length: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Search for archbishop, cardinal, bishop mentions church_hierarchy_terms = ['archbishop', 'cardinal', 'bishop', 'priest', 'monsignor'] colombia_terms = ['colombia', 'colombian', 'bogota', 'bogotá'] relief_terms = ['relief', 'aid', 'assistance', 'help', 'rescue', 'emergency', 'disaster response'] found_hierarchy = [] for term in church_hierarchy_terms: if term in page_text_lower: found_hierarchy.append(term) found_colombia = [] for term in colombia_terms: if term in page_text_lower: found_colombia.append(term) found_relief = [] for term in relief_terms: if term in page_text_lower: found_relief.append(term) print(f' Church hierarchy terms: {found_hierarchy}') print(f' Colombia terms: {found_colombia}') print(f' Relief terms: {found_relief}') # Look for specific patterns mentioning church leadership and disaster response patterns_to_search = [ r'archbishop[^.]{0,200}(relief|aid|disaster|response|help)', r'cardinal[^.]{0,200}(relief|aid|disaster|response|help)', r'bishop[^.]{0,200}(relief|aid|disaster|response|help)', r'catholic[^.]{0,200}church[^.]{0,200}(relief|aid|disaster|response)', r'(relief|aid|disaster|response)[^.]{0,200}(archbishop|cardinal|bishop)', r'church[^.]{0,200}(coordinate|lead|organize)[^.]{0,200}(relief|aid)' ] pattern_matches = [] for pattern in patterns_to_search: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text_lower, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) for match in matches: # Get surrounding context (200 chars before and after) start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 200) context = page_text[start:end].strip() pattern_matches.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match_text': match.group(), 'context': context, 'position': match.start() }) if pattern_matches: print(f' 🎯 Found {len(pattern_matches)} relevant pattern matches!') for i, match in enumerate(pattern_matches[:3], 1): # Show top 3 matches print(f'\n Match {i}:') print(f' Pattern: {match["pattern"]}') print(f' Context: ...{match["context"][:300]}...') # Store for further analysis church_leadership_info.append({ 'source': html_file, 'pattern': match['pattern'], 'context': match['context'], 'match_text': match['match_text'] }) else: print(' ❌ No specific church leadership + disaster relief patterns found') # Look for specific names that might be mentioned potential_names = [ 'mario revollo bravo', 'pedro rubiano', 'cardinal lopez', 'archbishop of bogota', 'archbishop of colombia' ] found_names = [] for name in potential_names: if name in page_text_lower: found_names.append(name) # Get context around the name name_pos = page_text_lower.find(name) if name_pos != -1: start = max(0, name_pos - 300) end = min(len(page_text), name_pos + 300) name_context = page_text[start:end].strip() archbishop_findings.append({ 'name': name, 'source': html_file, 'context': name_context, 'relevance': 'High - specific name mention' }) if found_names: print(f' 🎯 Found potential archbishop names: {found_names}') else: print(' ❌ No specific archbishop names found') print('\n=== ANALYZING DUCKDUCKGO SEARCH RESULTS ===') # Analyze DuckDuckGo JSON search results duckduckgo_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.startswith('duckduckgo_search_') and f.endswith('.json')] print(f'\nFound {len(duckduckgo_files)} DuckDuckGo search result files:') for ddg_file in duckduckgo_files: print(f'\n🔍 ANALYZING: {ddg_file}') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, ddg_file) with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: ddg_data = json.load(f) print(f' Keys in file: {list(ddg_data.keys())}') # Check for AbstractText if ddg_data.get('AbstractText'): abstract = ddg_data['AbstractText'] print(f' 📋 Abstract found: {abstract[:200]}...') # Look for archbishop mentions in abstract abstract_lower = abstract.lower() if any(term in abstract_lower for term in ['archbishop', 'cardinal', 'bishop']): print(' 🎯 Church hierarchy mentioned in abstract!') archbishop_findings.append({ 'source': f'DuckDuckGo - {ddg_file}', 'text': abstract, 'type': 'Search Abstract', 'relevance': 'High - direct search result' }) else: print(' ❌ No abstract found') # Check RelatedTopics if ddg_data.get('RelatedTopics'): topics = ddg_data['RelatedTopics'] print(f' 📋 Found {len(topics)} related topics') for i, topic in enumerate(topics[:3], 1): if isinstance(topic, dict) and 'Text' in topic: topic_text = topic['Text'] print(f' Topic {i}: {topic_text[:150]}...') # Look for church hierarchy in topics if any(term in topic_text.lower() for term in ['archbishop', 'cardinal', 'bishop']): print(' 🎯 Church hierarchy mentioned in topic!') archbishop_findings.append({ 'source': f'DuckDuckGo Topic - {ddg_file}', 'text': topic_text, 'type': 'Related Topic', 'relevance': 'Medium - related topic' }) else: print(' ❌ No related topics found') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) print(f'\n📊 DATA COLLECTION SUMMARY:') print(f' • Wikipedia HTML files analyzed: {len(html_files)}') print(f' • DuckDuckGo search results analyzed: {len(duckduckgo_files)}') print(f' • Archbishop findings collected: {len(archbishop_findings)}') print(f' • Church leadership info patterns: {len(church_leadership_info)}') if archbishop_findings: print(f'\n🎯 ARCHBISHOP FINDINGS SUMMARY:') for i, finding in enumerate(archbishop_findings, 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {finding["source"]}') print(f' Type: {finding.get("type", "Unknown")}') print(f' Relevance: {finding.get("relevance", "Unknown")}') if 'name' in finding: print(f' Name: {finding["name"].title()}') if 'text' in finding: print(f' Text: {finding["text"][:200]}...') elif 'context' in finding: print(f' Context: {finding["context"][:200]}...') else: print('\n❌ No specific archbishop findings yet') if church_leadership_info: print(f'\n⛪ CHURCH LEADERSHIP PATTERNS FOUND:') for i, info in enumerate(church_leadership_info[:3], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {info["source"]}') print(f' Pattern: {info["pattern"]}') print(f' Match: {info["match_text"]}') print(f' Context: {info["context"][:200]}...') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'task': 'Identify Archbishop who led 1985 Nevado del Ruiz disaster relief', 'data_sources_analyzed': { 'wikipedia_files': len(html_files), 'duckduckgo_files': len(duckduckgo_files), 'total_files': len(workspace_files) }, 'archbishop_findings': archbishop_findings, 'church_leadership_patterns': church_leadership_info, 'search_status': 'Data collection and initial analysis complete', 'next_steps': [ 'Continue targeted search for specific Colombian Archbishop names', 'Search for 1985 Colombian Catholic Church hierarchy', 'Look for news archives from November 1985', 'Search for disaster relief coordination records' ] } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'archbishop_analysis_{datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")}.json') with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n💾 Analysis results saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}') print(f'\n📋 CURRENT STATUS:') if archbishop_findings or church_leadership_info: print('✅ PROGRESS: Found some church-related information in disaster context') print('🔄 NEXT: Need more targeted search for specific Archbishop identification') else: print('⚠️ LIMITED FINDINGS: Need expanded search strategy') print('🔄 NEXT: Implement additional search approaches') print(f'\n🎯 RESEARCH OBJECTIVE: Identify the specific Archbishop who led Catholic Church disaster relief efforts during the November 13, 1985 Nevado del Ruiz volcanic eruption and Armero tragedy in Colombia')
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed a comprehensive analysis of all 18 workspace files. The analysis successfully processed 2 Wikipedia HTML files (Nevado del Ruiz and Armero tragedy pages) and 5 DuckDuckGo search result files, systematically searching for archbishop mentions, church hierarchy terms, and disaster relief patterns. However, the analysis revealed a critical finding: NO specific archbishop information was discovered in any of the collected data sources. The Wikipedia pages only contained generic terms like 'priest' but no archbishop, cardinal, or bishop mentions related to disaster relief coordination. All DuckDuckGo search results returned empty abstracts and related topics. **PLAN** alignment: 70% complete - thorough data analysis completed but the core objective (identifying the specific Archbishop) remains unachieved. The comprehensive analysis results were properly saved to 'archbishop_analysis_20250813_004111.json'. Next step: The current search strategy has been exhausted without finding the target information. Need to implement alternative research approaches such as searching Colombian Catholic Church archives, 1985 news sources, or papal records from that period.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime import re from bs4 import BeautifulSoup print('=== ANALYZING EXISTING NEVADO DEL RUIZ ARCHBISHOP SEARCH DATA ===') print('Objective: Inspect downloaded data and continue Archbishop identification') print('Focus: 1985 Colombian Catholic Church disaster relief leadership') print('=' * 80) # Check what files we have in workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f'\n📁 WORKSPACE FILES FOUND: {len(workspace_files)} files') for filename in sorted(workspace_files): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') else: print('❌ No workspace directory found') os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) print('✅ Created workspace directory') # Look for the main search results JSON file search_results_files = [f for f in workspace_files if 'nevado_ruiz_archbishop_search' in f and f.endswith('.json')] if search_results_files: # Use the most recent search results file results_file = max(search_results_files) results_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, results_file) print(f'\n🔍 ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS: {results_file}') # First, inspect the JSON structure safely print('\n=== JSON FILE STRUCTURE INSPECTION ===') with open(results_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f'Top-level keys: {list(search_data.keys())}') for key, value in search_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dictionary with {len(value)} keys') else: print(f' {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}...' if len(str(value)) > 100 else f' {key}: {value}') # Analyze archbishop mentions if they exist archbishop_mentions = search_data.get('archbishop_mentions', []) print(f'\n📋 ARCHBISHOP MENTIONS ANALYSIS: {len(archbishop_mentions)} found') if archbishop_mentions: for i, mention in enumerate(archbishop_mentions, 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {mention.get("source", "Unknown")}') print(f' Query: {mention.get("query", "N/A")}') print(f' Relevance: {mention.get("relevance", "N/A")}') print(f' Text: {mention.get("text", "")[:200]}...') else: print(' No archbishop mentions found in previous search') # Analyze church response details church_response = search_data.get('church_response_details', []) print(f'\n⛪ CHURCH RESPONSE DETAILS: {len(church_response)} found') for i, response in enumerate(church_response, 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {response.get("source", "Unknown")}') print(f' Keywords: {response.get("keywords_found", [])}') print(f' Section: {response.get("section", "")[:150]}...') else: print('\n❌ No main search results JSON file found') search_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'archbishop_mentions': [], 'church_response_details': [], 'wikipedia_sources': [] } print('\n=== ANALYZING DOWNLOADED WIKIPEDIA HTML FILES ===') # Analyze the Wikipedia HTML files that were successfully downloaded html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.startswith('nevado_ruiz_wiki_') and f.endswith('.html')] print(f'\nFound {len(html_files)} Wikipedia HTML files to analyze:') archbishop_findings = [] church_leadership_info = [] for html_file in html_files: print(f'\n🔍 ANALYZING: {html_file}') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') page_title = soup.find('title') print(f' Title: {page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else "Unknown"}') # Get full page text for analysis page_text = soup.get_text() page_text_lower = page_text.lower() print(f' Content length: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Search for archbishop, cardinal, bishop mentions church_hierarchy_terms = ['archbishop', 'cardinal', 'bishop', 'priest', 'monsignor'] colombia_terms = ['colombia', 'colombian', 'bogota', 'bogotá'] relief_terms = ['relief', 'aid', 'assistance', 'help', 'rescue', 'emergency', 'disaster response'] found_hierarchy = [] for term in church_hierarchy_terms: if term in page_text_lower: found_hierarchy.append(term) found_colombia = [] for term in colombia_terms: if term in page_text_lower: found_colombia.append(term) found_relief = [] for term in relief_terms: if term in page_text_lower: found_relief.append(term) print(f' Church hierarchy terms: {found_hierarchy}') print(f' Colombia terms: {found_colombia}') print(f' Relief terms: {found_relief}') # Look for specific patterns mentioning church leadership and disaster response patterns_to_search = [ r'archbishop[^.]{0,200}(relief|aid|disaster|response|help)', r'cardinal[^.]{0,200}(relief|aid|disaster|response|help)', r'bishop[^.]{0,200}(relief|aid|disaster|response|help)', r'catholic[^.]{0,200}church[^.]{0,200}(relief|aid|disaster|response)', r'(relief|aid|disaster|response)[^.]{0,200}(archbishop|cardinal|bishop)', r'church[^.]{0,200}(coordinate|lead|organize)[^.]{0,200}(relief|aid)' ] pattern_matches = [] for pattern in patterns_to_search: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text_lower, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) for match in matches: # Get surrounding context (200 chars before and after) start = max(0, match.start() - 200) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 200) context = page_text[start:end].strip() pattern_matches.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'match_text': match.group(), 'context': context, 'position': match.start() }) if pattern_matches: print(f' 🎯 Found {len(pattern_matches)} relevant pattern matches!') for i, match in enumerate(pattern_matches[:3], 1): # Show top 3 matches print(f'\n Match {i}:') print(f' Pattern: {match["pattern"]}') print(f' Context: ...{match["context"][:300]}...') # Store for further analysis church_leadership_info.append({ 'source': html_file, 'pattern': match['pattern'], 'context': match['context'], 'match_text': match['match_text'] }) else: print(' ❌ No specific church leadership + disaster relief patterns found') # Look for specific names that might be mentioned potential_names = [ 'mario revollo bravo', 'pedro rubiano', 'cardinal lopez', 'archbishop of bogota', 'archbishop of colombia' ] found_names = [] for name in potential_names: if name in page_text_lower: found_names.append(name) # Get context around the name name_pos = page_text_lower.find(name) if name_pos != -1: start = max(0, name_pos - 300) end = min(len(page_text), name_pos + 300) name_context = page_text[start:end].strip() archbishop_findings.append({ 'name': name, 'source': html_file, 'context': name_context, 'relevance': 'High - specific name mention' }) if found_names: print(f' 🎯 Found potential archbishop names: {found_names}') else: print(' ❌ No specific archbishop names found') print('\n=== ANALYZING DUCKDUCKGO SEARCH RESULTS ===') # Analyze DuckDuckGo JSON search results duckduckgo_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.startswith('duckduckgo_search_') and f.endswith('.json')] print(f'\nFound {len(duckduckgo_files)} DuckDuckGo search result files:') for ddg_file in duckduckgo_files: print(f'\n🔍 ANALYZING: {ddg_file}') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, ddg_file) with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: ddg_data = json.load(f) print(f' Keys in file: {list(ddg_data.keys())}') # Check for AbstractText if ddg_data.get('AbstractText'): abstract = ddg_data['AbstractText'] print(f' 📋 Abstract found: {abstract[:200]}...') # Look for archbishop mentions in abstract abstract_lower = abstract.lower() if any(term in abstract_lower for term in ['archbishop', 'cardinal', 'bishop']): print(' 🎯 Church hierarchy mentioned in abstract!') archbishop_findings.append({ 'source': f'DuckDuckGo - {ddg_file}', 'text': abstract, 'type': 'Search Abstract', 'relevance': 'High - direct search result' }) else: print(' ❌ No abstract found') # Check RelatedTopics if ddg_data.get('RelatedTopics'): topics = ddg_data['RelatedTopics'] print(f' 📋 Found {len(topics)} related topics') for i, topic in enumerate(topics[:3], 1): if isinstance(topic, dict) and 'Text' in topic: topic_text = topic['Text'] print(f' Topic {i}: {topic_text[:150]}...') # Look for church hierarchy in topics if any(term in topic_text.lower() for term in ['archbishop', 'cardinal', 'bishop']): print(' 🎯 Church hierarchy mentioned in topic!') archbishop_findings.append({ 'source': f'DuckDuckGo Topic - {ddg_file}', 'text': topic_text, 'type': 'Related Topic', 'relevance': 'Medium - related topic' }) else: print(' ❌ No related topics found') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) print(f'\n📊 DATA COLLECTION SUMMARY:') print(f' • Wikipedia HTML files analyzed: {len(html_files)}') print(f' • DuckDuckGo search results analyzed: {len(duckduckgo_files)}') print(f' • Archbishop findings collected: {len(archbishop_findings)}') print(f' • Church leadership info patterns: {len(church_leadership_info)}') if archbishop_findings: print(f'\n🎯 ARCHBISHOP FINDINGS SUMMARY:') for i, finding in enumerate(archbishop_findings, 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {finding["source"]}') print(f' Type: {finding.get("type", "Unknown")}') print(f' Relevance: {finding.get("relevance", "Unknown")}') if 'name' in finding: print(f' Name: {finding["name"].title()}') if 'text' in finding: print(f' Text: {finding["text"][:200]}...') elif 'context' in finding: print(f' Context: {finding["context"][:200]}...') else: print('\n❌ No specific archbishop findings yet') if church_leadership_info: print(f'\n⛪ CHURCH LEADERSHIP PATTERNS FOUND:') for i, info in enumerate(church_leadership_info[:3], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {info["source"]}') print(f' Pattern: {info["pattern"]}') print(f' Match: {info["match_text"]}') print(f' Context: {info["context"][:200]}...') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'task': 'Identify Archbishop who led 1985 Nevado del Ruiz disaster relief', 'data_sources_analyzed': { 'wikipedia_files': len(html_files), 'duckduckgo_files': len(duckduckgo_files), 'total_files': len(workspace_files) }, 'archbishop_findings': archbishop_findings, 'church_leadership_patterns': church_leadership_info, 'search_status': 'Data collection and initial analysis complete', 'next_steps': [ 'Continue targeted search for specific Colombian Archbishop names', 'Search for 1985 Colombian Catholic Church hierarchy', 'Look for news archives from November 1985', 'Search for disaster relief coordination records' ] } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'archbishop_analysis_{datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")}.json') with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n💾 Analysis results saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}') print(f'\n📋 CURRENT STATUS:') if archbishop_findings or church_leadership_info: print('✅ PROGRESS: Found some church-related information in disaster context') print('🔄 NEXT: Need more targeted search for specific Archbishop identification') else: print('⚠️ LIMITED FINDINGS: Need expanded search strategy') print('🔄 NEXT: Implement additional search approaches') print(f'\n🎯 RESEARCH OBJECTIVE: Identify the specific Archbishop who led Catholic Church disaster relief efforts during the November 13, 1985 Nevado del Ruiz volcanic eruption and Armero tragedy in Colombia')
Execution Output

terms: ['aid', 'help', 'emergency'] ❌ No specific church leadership + disaster relief patterns found ❌ No specific archbishop names found 🔍 ANALYZING: nevado_ruiz_wiki_2.html Title: Armero tragedy - 'emergency'] ❌ No specific church leadership + disaster relief patterns found ❌ No specific archbishop names found === ANALYZING DUCKDUCKGO SEARCH RESULTS === Found 5 DuckDuckGo search result files: 🔍 ANALYZING: duckduckgo_search_1.json Keys in file: ['Abstract', 'AbstractSource', 'AbstractText', 'AbstractURL', 'Answer', 'AnswerType', 'Definition', 'DefinitionSource', 'DefinitionURL', 'Entity', 'Heading', 'Image', 'ImageHeight', 'ImageIsLogo', 'ImageWidth', 'Infobox', 'Redirect', 'RelatedTopics', 'Results', 'Type', 'meta'] ❌ No abstract found ❌ No related topics found 🔍 ANALYZING: duckduckgo_search_4.json Keys in file: ['Abstract', 'AbstractSource', 'AbstractText', 'AbstractURL', 'Answer', 'AnswerType', 'Definition', 'DefinitionSource', 'DefinitionURL', 'Entity', 'Heading', 'Image', 'ImageHeight', 'ImageIsLogo', 'ImageWidth', 'Infobox', 'Redirect', 'RelatedTopics', 'Results', 'Type', 'meta'] ❌ No abstract found ❌ No related topics found 🔍 ANALYZING: duckduckgo_search_5.json Keys in file: ['Abstract', 'AbstractSource', 'AbstractText', 'AbstractURL', 'Answer', 'AnswerType', 'Definition', 'DefinitionSource', 'DefinitionURL', 'Entity', 'Heading', 'Image', 'ImageHeight', 'ImageIsLogo', 'ImageWidth', 'Infobox', 'Redirect', 'RelatedTopics', 'Results', 'Type', 'meta'] ❌ No abstract found ❌ No related topics found 🔍 ANALYZING: OBJECTIVE: Identify the specific Archbishop who led Catholic Church disaster relief efforts during the November 13, 1985 Nevado del Ruiz volcanic eruption and Armero tragedy in Colombia
developer
2025-08-13 00:43:39
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime import os import re print('=== EXPANDED SEARCH FOR 1985 COLOMBIAN ARCHBISHOP DISASTER RELIEF ===') print('Objective: Alternative search strategies for Catholic Church leadership') print('Focus: Colombian Catholic hierarchy in 1985 and disaster response records') print('=' * 80) # Create workspace directory workspace_dir = 'workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) # Request headers headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print('\n=== STEP 1: COLOMBIAN CATHOLIC CHURCH HIERARCHY 1985 ===\n') # Search for specific Colombian Catholic Church leadership in 1985 columbian_hierarchy_searches = [ 'Archbishop of Bogota 1985', 'Cardinal Mario Revollo Bravo Colombia', 'Colombian Catholic Church leaders 1985', 'Archdiocese of Bogota 1980s leadership', 'Catholic bishops Colombia 1985 list' ] hierarchy_findings = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'hierarchy_searches': [], 'potential_archbishops': [], 'church_leadership_1985': [], 'disaster_response_mentions': [] } for i, query in enumerate(columbian_hierarchy_searches, 1): print(f'{i}. Searching: "{query}"') try: # Use DuckDuckGo search search_url = f'https://api.duckduckgo.com/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}&format=json&no_html=1&skip_disambig=1' response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: data = response.json() search_info = { 'query': query, 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'results_found': False, 'abstract': '', 'related_topics': [], 'relevant_names': [] } # Check abstract if data.get('AbstractText'): abstract = data['AbstractText'] print(f' ✅ Abstract: {abstract[:150]}...') search_info['abstract'] = abstract search_info['results_found'] = True # Look for specific names in abstract name_patterns = [ r'archbishop\s+([A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*)', r'cardinal\s+([A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*)', r'bishop\s+([A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*)', r'([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)\s+archbishop', r'mario\s+revollo\s+bravo', r'pedro\s+rubiano' ] for pattern in name_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, abstract, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: name = match.group(1) if match.groups() else match.group() search_info['relevant_names'].append(name) print(f' 🎯 Found name: {name}') hierarchy_findings['potential_archbishops'].append({ 'name': name, 'source': 'DuckDuckGo Abstract', 'query': query, 'context': abstract, 'relevance': 'High' }) # Check related topics if data.get('RelatedTopics'): topics = data['RelatedTopics'] print(f' 📋 Found {len(topics)} related topics') for topic in topics[:5]: if isinstance(topic, dict) and 'Text' in topic: topic_text = topic['Text'] search_info['related_topics'].append(topic_text) # Look for church hierarchy in topics if any(term in topic_text.lower() for term in ['archbishop', 'cardinal', 'bishop', 'colombia']): print(f' 🎯 Relevant topic: {topic_text[:100]}...') # Extract names from topics for pattern in name_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, topic_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: name = match.group(1) if match.groups() else match.group() search_info['relevant_names'].append(name) hierarchy_findings['potential_archbishops'].append({ 'name': name, 'source': 'DuckDuckGo Topic', 'query': query, 'context': topic_text, 'relevance': 'Medium' }) hierarchy_findings['hierarchy_searches'].append(search_info) # Save individual search result search_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'hierarchy_search_{i}.json') with open(search_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f' 📁 Saved to: {os.path.basename(search_file)}') else: print(f' ❌ Search error: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print('\n=== STEP 2: HISTORICAL NEWS ARCHIVES SEARCH ===\n') # Search for historical news coverage of the disaster and church response news_archive_searches = [ '"November 1985" "Nevado del Ruiz" "Catholic Church" Colombia', '"Armero tragedy" "Archbishop" "disaster relief" 1985', '"Colombian Catholic Church" "volcanic eruption" "aid" 1985', '"Church coordination" "Nevado del Ruiz" "relief efforts"', '"Catholic aid" "Colombia" "volcanic disaster" 1985' ] for i, query in enumerate(news_archive_searches, 1): print(f'{i}. News archive search: "{query}"') try: search_url = f'https://api.duckduckgo.com/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}&format=json&no_html=1&skip_disambig=1' response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: data = response.json() # Check for disaster response mentions if data.get('AbstractText'): abstract = data['AbstractText'] print(f' 📋 Abstract: {abstract[:150]}...') # Look for disaster response and church coordination if any(term in abstract.lower() for term in ['relief', 'aid', 'rescue', 'coordinate', 'church', 'archbishop']): print(' 🎯 Disaster response context found!') hierarchy_findings['disaster_response_mentions'].append({ 'source': 'News Archive Search', 'query': query, 'text': abstract, 'type': 'Disaster Response Context' }) # Save news search result news_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'news_search_{i}.json') with open(news_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f' 📁 Saved to: {os.path.basename(news_file)}') else: print(f' ❌ Search error: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print('\n=== STEP 3: SPECIFIC ARCHBISHOP NAME SEARCHES ===\n') # Search for specific archbishops who might have been in Colombia in 1985 specific_archbishop_searches = [ 'Mario Revollo Bravo Archbishop Colombia 1985', 'Pedro Rubiano Saenz Archbishop Bogota 1985', 'Cardinal Lopez Trujillo Colombia 1985', 'Anibal Munoz Duque Archbishop Colombia', 'Jose Joaquin Salcedo Colombia Catholic Church 1985' ] for i, query in enumerate(specific_archbishop_searches, 1): print(f'{i}. Specific archbishop search: "{query}"') try: search_url = f'https://api.duckduckgo.com/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}&format=json&no_html=1&skip_disambig=1' response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: data = response.json() # Check for biographical information if data.get('AbstractText'): abstract = data['AbstractText'] print(f' 📋 Biography: {abstract[:200]}...') # Look for 1985 timeline and disaster mentions if '1985' in abstract or any(term in abstract.lower() for term in ['disaster', 'relief', 'aid', 'volcanic', 'armero']): print(' 🎯 1985 timeline or disaster context found!') # Extract the name from the query name_match = re.search(r'^([A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*)', query) archbishop_name = name_match.group(1) if name_match else 'Unknown' hierarchy_findings['church_leadership_1985'].append({ 'name': archbishop_name, 'source': 'Specific Name Search', 'query': query, 'biography': abstract, 'timeline_relevance': '1985 mentioned' if '1985' in abstract else 'Disaster context', 'relevance': 'High' }) # Save specific search result specific_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'specific_archbishop_{i}.json') with open(specific_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f' 📁 Saved to: {os.path.basename(specific_file)}') else: print(f' ❌ Search error: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print('\n=== STEP 4: VATICAN AND PAPAL RECORDS SEARCH ===\n') # Search for Vatican records or papal communications about the disaster vatican_searches = [ 'Pope John Paul II Colombia 1985 volcanic disaster', 'Vatican response Nevado del Ruiz eruption 1985', 'Papal message Colombia Armero tragedy 1985', 'Holy See disaster relief Colombia 1985', 'Catholic Church official response volcanic disaster Colombia' ] for i, query in enumerate(vatican_searches, 1): print(f'{i}. Vatican records search: "{query}"') try: search_url = f'https://api.duckduckgo.com/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}&format=json&no_html=1&skip_disambig=1' response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: data = response.json() # Check for Vatican or papal mentions if data.get('AbstractText'): abstract = data['AbstractText'] print(f' 📋 Vatican context: {abstract[:150]}...') # Look for church coordination mentions if any(term in abstract.lower() for term in ['archbishop', 'coordinate', 'relief', 'church response']): print(' 🎯 Church coordination mentioned!') hierarchy_findings['disaster_response_mentions'].append({ 'source': 'Vatican Records Search', 'query': query, 'text': abstract, 'type': 'Vatican/Papal Context' }) # Save Vatican search result vatican_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'vatican_search_{i}.json') with open(vatican_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f' 📁 Saved to: {os.path.basename(vatican_file)}') else: print(f' ❌ Search error: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('EXPANDED SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) # Analyze and summarize findings print(f'\n📊 SEARCH SUMMARY:') print(f' • Hierarchy searches: {len(hierarchy_findings["hierarchy_searches"])} completed') print(f' • Potential archbishops identified: {len(hierarchy_findings["potential_archbishops"])}') print(f' • Church leadership 1985: {len(hierarchy_findings["church_leadership_1985"])}') print(f' • Disaster response mentions: {len(hierarchy_findings["disaster_response_mentions"])}') if hierarchy_findings['potential_archbishops']: print(f'\n🎯 POTENTIAL ARCHBISHOPS IDENTIFIED:') # Remove duplicates and rank by relevance unique_archbishops = {} for archbishop in hierarchy_findings['potential_archbishops']: name = archbishop['name'].strip().title() if name not in unique_archbishops or archbishop['relevance'] == 'High': unique_archbishops[name] = archbishop for i, (name, info) in enumerate(unique_archbishops.items(), 1): print(f'\n{i}. {name}') print(f' Source: {info["source"]}') print(f' Query: {info["query"]}') print(f' Relevance: {info["relevance"]}') print(f' Context: {info["context"][:150]}...') if hierarchy_findings['church_leadership_1985']: print(f'\n⛪ 1985 CHURCH LEADERSHIP FINDINGS:') for i, leader in enumerate(hierarchy_findings['church_leadership_1985'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {leader["name"]}') print(f' Timeline: {leader["timeline_relevance"]}') print(f' Biography: {leader["biography"][:200]}...') if hierarchy_findings['disaster_response_mentions']: print(f'\n🚨 DISASTER RESPONSE CONTEXT:') for i, mention in enumerate(hierarchy_findings['disaster_response_mentions'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Type: {mention["type"]}') print(f' Source: {mention["source"]}') print(f' Text: {mention["text"][:200]}...') # Save comprehensive findings findings_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'expanded_archbishop_search_{datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")}.json') with open(findings_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(hierarchy_findings, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n💾 Expanded search results saved to: {os.path.basename(findings_file)}') # Final assessment print(f'\n📋 RESEARCH STATUS:') if hierarchy_findings['potential_archbishops'] or hierarchy_findings['church_leadership_1985']: print('✅ PROGRESS: Found potential Colombian Catholic Church leadership information') print('🔄 NEXT: Analyze specific names and verify 1985 disaster relief roles') else: print('⚠️ CHALLENGE: Limited specific archbishop information available') print('🔄 NEXT: May need to search Colombian historical archives or church records') print(f'\n🎯 TARGET: Identify the specific Archbishop who coordinated Catholic Church disaster relief efforts during the November 13, 1985 Nevado del Ruiz volcanic eruption in Colombia') print(f'\n📁 All search data saved to workspace for further analysis')
Execution Output

Searching: "Archbishop of Bogota 1985" 📁 Saved to: hierarchy_search_1.json 2. Searching: "Cardinal Mario Revollo Bravo Colombia" 📁 Saved to: hierarchy_search_2.json 3. Searching: "Catholic bishops Colombia 1985 list" 📁 Saved to: hierarchy_search_5.json === STEP 2: HISTORICAL NEWS ARCHIVES SEARCH === 1. News archive search: ""November 1985" "Nevado del Ruiz" "Catholic Church" Colombia" 📁 Saved to: news_search_1.json 2. News archive search: ""Armero tragedy" "Archbishop" "disaster relief" 1985" 📁 Saved to: news_search_2.json 3. Specific archbishop search: "Mario Revollo Bravo Archbishop Colombia 1985" 📁 Saved to: specific_archbishop_1.json 2. Tester Feedback:
Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed all 4 search steps (Colombian Catholic Church hierarchy, historical news archives, specific archbishop names, and Vatican records). The expanded search strategy executed 20 different targeted queries across multiple categories and successfully saved all search results to workspace files. However, the critical finding is that NO specific archbishop information was discovered despite the comprehensive approach - all search summaries show 0 potential archbishops identified, 0 church leadership findings, and 0 disaster response mentions. The DuckDuckGo API searches appear to be returning empty results (no abstracts or related topics), suggesting either API limitations or the specific information may not be readily available through these search methods. **PLAN** alignment: 80% complete - extensive search methodology executed but core objective (identifying the Archbishop) remains unachieved. The search results were properly saved to 'expanded_archbishop_search_20250813_004331.json' for reference. Next step: Consider alternative research approaches such as accessing Colombian Catholic Church official records, historical newspaper archives from November 1985, or contacting religious history specialists, as the current web-based search strategies have been exhausted without success.
Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from datetime import datetime import os import re print('=== EXPANDED SEARCH FOR 1985 COLOMBIAN ARCHBISHOP DISASTER RELIEF ===') print('Objective: Alternative search strategies for Catholic Church leadership') print('Focus: Colombian Catholic hierarchy in 1985 and disaster response records') print('=' * 80) # Create workspace directory workspace_dir = 'workspace' os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) # Request headers headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print('\n=== STEP 1: COLOMBIAN CATHOLIC CHURCH HIERARCHY 1985 ===\n') # Search for specific Colombian Catholic Church leadership in 1985 columbian_hierarchy_searches = [ 'Archbishop of Bogota 1985', 'Cardinal Mario Revollo Bravo Colombia', 'Colombian Catholic Church leaders 1985', 'Archdiocese of Bogota 1980s leadership', 'Catholic bishops Colombia 1985 list' ] hierarchy_findings = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'hierarchy_searches': [], 'potential_archbishops': [], 'church_leadership_1985': [], 'disaster_response_mentions': [] } for i, query in enumerate(columbian_hierarchy_searches, 1): print(f'{i}. Searching: "{query}"') try: # Use DuckDuckGo search search_url = f'https://api.duckduckgo.com/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}&format=json&no_html=1&skip_disambig=1' response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: data = response.json() search_info = { 'query': query, 'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'results_found': False, 'abstract': '', 'related_topics': [], 'relevant_names': [] } # Check abstract if data.get('AbstractText'): abstract = data['AbstractText'] print(f' ✅ Abstract: {abstract[:150]}...') search_info['abstract'] = abstract search_info['results_found'] = True # Look for specific names in abstract name_patterns = [ r'archbishop\s+([A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*)', r'cardinal\s+([A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*)', r'bishop\s+([A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*)', r'([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)\s+archbishop', r'mario\s+revollo\s+bravo', r'pedro\s+rubiano' ] for pattern in name_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, abstract, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: name = match.group(1) if match.groups() else match.group() search_info['relevant_names'].append(name) print(f' 🎯 Found name: {name}') hierarchy_findings['potential_archbishops'].append({ 'name': name, 'source': 'DuckDuckGo Abstract', 'query': query, 'context': abstract, 'relevance': 'High' }) # Check related topics if data.get('RelatedTopics'): topics = data['RelatedTopics'] print(f' 📋 Found {len(topics)} related topics') for topic in topics[:5]: if isinstance(topic, dict) and 'Text' in topic: topic_text = topic['Text'] search_info['related_topics'].append(topic_text) # Look for church hierarchy in topics if any(term in topic_text.lower() for term in ['archbishop', 'cardinal', 'bishop', 'colombia']): print(f' 🎯 Relevant topic: {topic_text[:100]}...') # Extract names from topics for pattern in name_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, topic_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: name = match.group(1) if match.groups() else match.group() search_info['relevant_names'].append(name) hierarchy_findings['potential_archbishops'].append({ 'name': name, 'source': 'DuckDuckGo Topic', 'query': query, 'context': topic_text, 'relevance': 'Medium' }) hierarchy_findings['hierarchy_searches'].append(search_info) # Save individual search result search_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'hierarchy_search_{i}.json') with open(search_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f' 📁 Saved to: {os.path.basename(search_file)}') else: print(f' ❌ Search error: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print('\n=== STEP 2: HISTORICAL NEWS ARCHIVES SEARCH ===\n') # Search for historical news coverage of the disaster and church response news_archive_searches = [ '"November 1985" "Nevado del Ruiz" "Catholic Church" Colombia', '"Armero tragedy" "Archbishop" "disaster relief" 1985', '"Colombian Catholic Church" "volcanic eruption" "aid" 1985', '"Church coordination" "Nevado del Ruiz" "relief efforts"', '"Catholic aid" "Colombia" "volcanic disaster" 1985' ] for i, query in enumerate(news_archive_searches, 1): print(f'{i}. News archive search: "{query}"') try: search_url = f'https://api.duckduckgo.com/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}&format=json&no_html=1&skip_disambig=1' response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: data = response.json() # Check for disaster response mentions if data.get('AbstractText'): abstract = data['AbstractText'] print(f' 📋 Abstract: {abstract[:150]}...') # Look for disaster response and church coordination if any(term in abstract.lower() for term in ['relief', 'aid', 'rescue', 'coordinate', 'church', 'archbishop']): print(' 🎯 Disaster response context found!') hierarchy_findings['disaster_response_mentions'].append({ 'source': 'News Archive Search', 'query': query, 'text': abstract, 'type': 'Disaster Response Context' }) # Save news search result news_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'news_search_{i}.json') with open(news_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f' 📁 Saved to: {os.path.basename(news_file)}') else: print(f' ❌ Search error: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print('\n=== STEP 3: SPECIFIC ARCHBISHOP NAME SEARCHES ===\n') # Search for specific archbishops who might have been in Colombia in 1985 specific_archbishop_searches = [ 'Mario Revollo Bravo Archbishop Colombia 1985', 'Pedro Rubiano Saenz Archbishop Bogota 1985', 'Cardinal Lopez Trujillo Colombia 1985', 'Anibal Munoz Duque Archbishop Colombia', 'Jose Joaquin Salcedo Colombia Catholic Church 1985' ] for i, query in enumerate(specific_archbishop_searches, 1): print(f'{i}. Specific archbishop search: "{query}"') try: search_url = f'https://api.duckduckgo.com/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}&format=json&no_html=1&skip_disambig=1' response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: data = response.json() # Check for biographical information if data.get('AbstractText'): abstract = data['AbstractText'] print(f' 📋 Biography: {abstract[:200]}...') # Look for 1985 timeline and disaster mentions if '1985' in abstract or any(term in abstract.lower() for term in ['disaster', 'relief', 'aid', 'volcanic', 'armero']): print(' 🎯 1985 timeline or disaster context found!') # Extract the name from the query name_match = re.search(r'^([A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*)', query) archbishop_name = name_match.group(1) if name_match else 'Unknown' hierarchy_findings['church_leadership_1985'].append({ 'name': archbishop_name, 'source': 'Specific Name Search', 'query': query, 'biography': abstract, 'timeline_relevance': '1985 mentioned' if '1985' in abstract else 'Disaster context', 'relevance': 'High' }) # Save specific search result specific_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'specific_archbishop_{i}.json') with open(specific_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f' 📁 Saved to: {os.path.basename(specific_file)}') else: print(f' ❌ Search error: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print('\n=== STEP 4: VATICAN AND PAPAL RECORDS SEARCH ===\n') # Search for Vatican records or papal communications about the disaster vatican_searches = [ 'Pope John Paul II Colombia 1985 volcanic disaster', 'Vatican response Nevado del Ruiz eruption 1985', 'Papal message Colombia Armero tragedy 1985', 'Holy See disaster relief Colombia 1985', 'Catholic Church official response volcanic disaster Colombia' ] for i, query in enumerate(vatican_searches, 1): print(f'{i}. Vatican records search: "{query}"') try: search_url = f'https://api.duckduckgo.com/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}&format=json&no_html=1&skip_disambig=1' response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: data = response.json() # Check for Vatican or papal mentions if data.get('AbstractText'): abstract = data['AbstractText'] print(f' 📋 Vatican context: {abstract[:150]}...') # Look for church coordination mentions if any(term in abstract.lower() for term in ['archbishop', 'coordinate', 'relief', 'church response']): print(' 🎯 Church coordination mentioned!') hierarchy_findings['disaster_response_mentions'].append({ 'source': 'Vatican Records Search', 'query': query, 'text': abstract, 'type': 'Vatican/Papal Context' }) # Save Vatican search result vatican_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'vatican_search_{i}.json') with open(vatican_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f' 📁 Saved to: {os.path.basename(vatican_file)}') else: print(f' ❌ Search error: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('EXPANDED SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY') print('=' * 80) # Analyze and summarize findings print(f'\n📊 SEARCH SUMMARY:') print(f' • Hierarchy searches: {len(hierarchy_findings["hierarchy_searches"])} completed') print(f' • Potential archbishops identified: {len(hierarchy_findings["potential_archbishops"])}') print(f' • Church leadership 1985: {len(hierarchy_findings["church_leadership_1985"])}') print(f' • Disaster response mentions: {len(hierarchy_findings["disaster_response_mentions"])}') if hierarchy_findings['potential_archbishops']: print(f'\n🎯 POTENTIAL ARCHBISHOPS IDENTIFIED:') # Remove duplicates and rank by relevance unique_archbishops = {} for archbishop in hierarchy_findings['potential_archbishops']: name = archbishop['name'].strip().title() if name not in unique_archbishops or archbishop['relevance'] == 'High': unique_archbishops[name] = archbishop for i, (name, info) in enumerate(unique_archbishops.items(), 1): print(f'\n{i}. {name}') print(f' Source: {info["source"]}') print(f' Query: {info["query"]}') print(f' Relevance: {info["relevance"]}') print(f' Context: {info["context"][:150]}...') if hierarchy_findings['church_leadership_1985']: print(f'\n⛪ 1985 CHURCH LEADERSHIP FINDINGS:') for i, leader in enumerate(hierarchy_findings['church_leadership_1985'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {leader["name"]}') print(f' Timeline: {leader["timeline_relevance"]}') print(f' Biography: {leader["biography"][:200]}...') if hierarchy_findings['disaster_response_mentions']: print(f'\n🚨 DISASTER RESPONSE CONTEXT:') for i, mention in enumerate(hierarchy_findings['disaster_response_mentions'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Type: {mention["type"]}') print(f' Source: {mention["source"]}') print(f' Text: {mention["text"][:200]}...') # Save comprehensive findings findings_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'expanded_archbishop_search_{datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")}.json') with open(findings_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(hierarchy_findings, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n💾 Expanded search results saved to: {os.path.basename(findings_file)}') # Final assessment print(f'\n📋 RESEARCH STATUS:') if hierarchy_findings['potential_archbishops'] or hierarchy_findings['church_leadership_1985']: print('✅ PROGRESS: Found potential Colombian Catholic Church leadership information') print('🔄 NEXT: Analyze specific names and verify 1985 disaster relief roles') else: print('⚠️ CHALLENGE: Limited specific archbishop information available') print('🔄 NEXT: May need to search Colombian historical archives or church records') print(f'\n🎯 TARGET: Identify the specific Archbishop who coordinated Catholic Church disaster relief efforts during the November 13, 1985 Nevado del Ruiz volcanic eruption in Colombia') print(f'\n📁 All search data saved to workspace for further analysis')
Execution Output
Code Output: === EXPANDED SEARCH FOR 1985 COLOMBIAN ARCHBISHOP DISASTER RELIEF === Objective: Alternative search strategies for Catholic Church leadership Focus: Colombian Catholic hierarchy in 1985 and disaster response records ================================================================================ === STEP 1: COLOMBIAN CATHOLIC CHURCH HIERARCHY 1985 === 1. Searching: "Archbishop of Bogota 1985" 📁 Saved to: hierarchy_search_1.json 2. Searching: "Cardinal Mario Revollo Bravo Colombia" 📁 Saved to: hierarchy_search_2.json 3. Searching: "Colombian Catholic Church leaders 1985" 📁 Saved to: hierarchy_search_3.json 4. Searching: "Archdiocese of Bogota 1980s leadership" 📁 Saved to: hierarchy_search_4.json 5. Searching: "Catholic bishops Colombia 1985 list" 📁 Saved to: hierarchy_search_5.json === STEP 2: HISTORICAL NEWS ARCHIVES SEARCH === 1. News archive search: ""November 1985" "Nevado del Ruiz" "Catholic Church" Colombia" 📁 Saved to: news_search_1.json 2. News archive search: ""Armero tragedy" "Archbishop" "disaster relief" 1985" 📁 Saved to: news_search_2.json 3. News archive search: ""Colombian Catholic Church" "volcanic eruption" "aid" 1985" 📁 Saved to: news_search_3.json [WORKSPACE] Using task-specific workspace: workspace_webshaper_70 === STEP 3: SPECIFIC ARCHBISHOP NAME SEARCHES === 1. Specific archbishop search: "Mario Revollo Bravo Archbishop Colombia 1985" 📁 Saved to: specific_archbishop_1.json 2. Specific archbishop search: "Pedro Rubiano Saenz Archbishop Bogota 1985" 📁 Saved to: specific_archbishop_2.json 3. Specific archbishop search: "Cardinal Lopez Trujillo Colombia 1985" 📁 Saved to: specific_archbishop_3.json 4. Specific archbishop search: "Anibal Munoz Duque Archbishop Colombia" 📁 Saved to: specific_archbishop_4.json 5. Specific archbishop search: "Jose Joaquin Salcedo Colombia Catholic Church 1985" 📁 Saved to: specific_archbishop_5.json === STEP 4: VATICAN AND PAPAL RECORDS SEARCH === 1. Vatican records search: "Pope John Paul II Colombia 1985 volcanic disaster" 📁 Saved to: vatican_search_1.json 2. Vatican records search: "Vatican response Nevado del Ruiz eruption 1985" 📁 Saved to: vatican_search_2.json 3. Vatican records search: "Papal message Colombia Armero tragedy 1985" 📁 Saved to: vatican_search_3.json 4. Vatican records search: "Holy See disaster relief Colombia 1985" 📁 Saved to: vatican_search_4.json 5. Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 4)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime import re from bs4 import BeautifulSoup print('=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF ALL ARCHBISHOP SEARCH DATA ===') print('Objective: Final analysis of all collected data for Archbishop identification') print('Focus: Extract any available information about Colombian Catholic Church disaster response') print('=' * 80) # Check workspace contents workspace_dir = 'workspace' if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): all_files = sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)) print(f'\n📁 TOTAL WORKSPACE FILES: {len(all_files)}') # Categorize files json_files = [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.json')] html_files = [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f' • JSON files: {len(json_files)}') print(f' • HTML files: {len(html_files)}') else: print('❌ No workspace directory found') exit() print('\n=== STEP 1: COMPREHENSIVE JSON FILE ANALYSIS ===\n') # Analyze all JSON files systematically all_findings = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'files_analyzed': 0, 'archbishop_mentions': [], 'church_hierarchy_names': [], 'disaster_response_context': [], 'colombian_church_info': [], 'timeline_1985_mentions': [] } for json_file in json_files: print(f'🔍 ANALYZING: {json_file}') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, json_file) try: # First, safely inspect the file structure with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f' Keys: {list(data.keys()) if isinstance(data, dict) else "Not a dictionary"}') all_findings['files_analyzed'] += 1 # Check for AbstractText if isinstance(data, dict) and data.get('AbstractText'): abstract = data['AbstractText'] print(f' 📋 Abstract found: {abstract[:100]}...') # Look for church hierarchy terms hierarchy_terms = ['archbishop', 'cardinal', 'bishop', 'monsignor', 'priest'] found_hierarchy = [term for term in hierarchy_terms if term.lower() in abstract.lower()] if found_hierarchy: print(f' 🎯 Church hierarchy terms: {found_hierarchy}') all_findings['archbishop_mentions'].append({ 'source': json_file, 'text': abstract, 'hierarchy_terms': found_hierarchy, 'type': 'Abstract' }) # Look for specific names using regex name_patterns = [ r'(Mario\s+Revollo\s+Bravo)', r'(Pedro\s+Rubiano\s+Saenz?)', r'(Lopez\s+Trujillo)', r'(Anibal\s+Munoz\s+Duque)', r'(Cardinal\s+[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*)', r'(Archbishop\s+[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*)', r'([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)(?=\s+(?:Archbishop|Cardinal|Bishop))' ] for pattern in name_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, abstract, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: name = match.group(1) print(f' 🎯 Found name: {name}') all_findings['church_hierarchy_names'].append({ 'name': name, 'source': json_file, 'context': abstract, 'pattern_matched': pattern }) # Look for 1985 and disaster terms if '1985' in abstract: print(' 📅 1985 mentioned!') all_findings['timeline_1985_mentions'].append({ 'source': json_file, 'text': abstract, 'type': '1985 Timeline' }) # Look for disaster response terms disaster_terms = ['disaster', 'relief', 'aid', 'emergency', 'rescue', 'volcanic', 'eruption', 'armero', 'nevado'] found_disaster = [term for term in disaster_terms if term.lower() in abstract.lower()] if found_disaster: print(f' 🚨 Disaster terms: {found_disaster}') all_findings['disaster_response_context'].append({ 'source': json_file, 'text': abstract, 'disaster_terms': found_disaster, 'type': 'Disaster Context' }) # Check RelatedTopics if isinstance(data, dict) and data.get('RelatedTopics'): topics = data['RelatedTopics'] if topics: print(f' 📋 {len(topics)} related topics found') for i, topic in enumerate(topics[:3]): if isinstance(topic, dict) and topic.get('Text'): topic_text = topic['Text'] # Look for church hierarchy in topics hierarchy_in_topic = [term for term in hierarchy_terms if term.lower() in topic_text.lower()] if hierarchy_in_topic: print(f' 🎯 Topic {i+1} has hierarchy: {hierarchy_in_topic}') print(f' Text: {topic_text[:100]}...') all_findings['archbishop_mentions'].append({ 'source': f'{json_file} - Topic {i+1}', 'text': topic_text, 'hierarchy_terms': hierarchy_in_topic, 'type': 'Related Topic' }) # Check for other relevant keys relevant_keys = ['church_leadership_1985', 'potential_archbishops', 'disaster_response_mentions', 'archbishop_mentions'] for key in relevant_keys: if isinstance(data, dict) and data.get(key): value = data[key] if isinstance(value, list) and value: print(f' 📋 Found {key}: {len(value)} items') for item in value[:2]: # Show first 2 items if isinstance(item, dict): name = item.get('name', 'Unknown') context = item.get('text', item.get('context', item.get('biography', ''))) print(f' • {name}: {context[:80]}...') all_findings['colombian_church_info'].append({ 'source': json_file, 'key': key, 'name': name, 'context': context, 'item_data': item }) print() except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error analyzing {json_file}: {str(e)}') print() print('\n=== STEP 2: COMPREHENSIVE HTML FILE ANALYSIS ===\n') # Deep analysis of HTML files for any missed information for html_file in html_files: print(f'🔍 DEEP ANALYSIS: {html_file}') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text() print(f' Content length: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Search for any mention of specific Colombian archbishops or church leaders search_terms = [ 'mario revollo bravo', 'pedro rubiano', 'lopez trujillo', 'anibal munoz duque', 'archbishop of bogota', 'cardinal of colombia', 'catholic church colombia', 'church relief', 'church aid', 'church response', 'church coordination', 'religious aid', 'catholic aid' ] found_terms = [] for term in search_terms: if term.lower() in page_text.lower(): found_terms.append(term) if found_terms: print(f' 🎯 Found terms: {found_terms}') # Get context for each found term for term in found_terms[:3]: # Limit to first 3 to avoid too much output term_pos = page_text.lower().find(term.lower()) if term_pos != -1: start = max(0, term_pos - 200) end = min(len(page_text), term_pos + 200) context = page_text[start:end].strip() print(f' Context for "{term}":') print(f' {context[:300]}...') all_findings['colombian_church_info'].append({ 'source': html_file, 'term': term, 'context': context, 'type': 'HTML Content' }) print() else: print(' ❌ No specific church leadership terms found') # Look for any patterns that might indicate church disaster response response_patterns = [ r'church[^.]{0,100}(coordinate|lead|organize|provide)[^.]{0,100}(relief|aid|help)', r'(archbishop|cardinal|bishop)[^.]{0,100}(disaster|emergency|relief|aid)', r'catholic[^.]{0,100}(response|aid|relief|help)[^.]{0,100}(disaster|emergency|volcanic)', r'(relief|aid)[^.]{0,100}(coordinate|organize|lead)[^.]{0,100}(church|catholic|archbishop)' ] pattern_matches = [] for pattern in response_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text.lower(), re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL)) if matches: print(f' 🎯 Found {len(matches)} matches for pattern: {pattern[:50]}...') for match in matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches start = max(0, match.start() - 150) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 150) context = page_text[start:end].strip() print(f' Match context: {context[:200]}...') pattern_matches.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'context': context, 'source': html_file }) if pattern_matches: all_findings['disaster_response_context'].extend(pattern_matches) print() except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error analyzing {html_file}: {str(e)}') print() print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS') print('=' * 80) print(f'\n📊 ANALYSIS SUMMARY:') print(f' • Total files analyzed: {all_findings["files_analyzed"]} JSON + {len(html_files)} HTML') print(f' • Archbishop mentions found: {len(all_findings["archbishop_mentions"])}') print(f' • Church hierarchy names: {len(all_findings["church_hierarchy_names"])}') print(f' • Colombian church info: {len(all_findings["colombian_church_info"])}') print(f' • Disaster response context: {len(all_findings["disaster_response_context"])}') print(f' • 1985 timeline mentions: {len(all_findings["timeline_1985_mentions"])}') # Consolidate and present findings if all_findings['church_hierarchy_names']: print(f'\n🎯 CHURCH HIERARCHY NAMES IDENTIFIED:') unique_names = set() for name_info in all_findings['church_hierarchy_names']: name = name_info['name'].strip().title() if name not in unique_names: unique_names.add(name) print(f' • {name} (Source: {name_info["source"]})') print(f' Context: {name_info["context"][:150]}...') print() if all_findings['colombian_church_info']: print(f'\n⛪ COLOMBIAN CHURCH INFORMATION:') for i, info in enumerate(all_findings['colombian_church_info'][:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {info["source"]}') if 'name' in info: print(f' Name: {info["name"]}') if 'term' in info: print(f' Term: {info["term"]}') print(f' Context: {info["context"][:200]}...') if all_findings['disaster_response_context']: print(f'\n🚨 DISASTER RESPONSE CONTEXT:') for i, context in enumerate(all_findings['disaster_response_context'][:3], 1): print(f'\n{i}. Source: {context["source"]}') if 'disaster_terms' in context: print(f' Disaster terms: {context["disaster_terms"]}') print(f' Context: {context.get("text", context.get("context", ""))[:200]}...') # Save final comprehensive analysis final_analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'final_archbishop_analysis_{datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")}.json') with open(final_analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(all_findings, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n💾 Final analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(final_analysis_file)}') print(f'\n📋 RESEARCH CONCLUSION:') if (all_findings['church_hierarchy_names'] or all_findings['colombian_church_info'] or all_findings['disaster_response_context']): print('✅ PARTIAL SUCCESS: Found some church-related information') print('📝 RECOMMENDATION: The available web sources may not contain specific details') print(' about which Archbishop led the 1985 Nevado del Ruiz disaster relief efforts.') print('🔍 ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES NEEDED:') print(' • Contact Colombian Catholic Church archives directly') print(' • Search historical newspaper archives from November 1985') print(' • Consult academic papers on Colombian church history') print(' • Check Vatican archives for official communications') else: print('❌ LIMITED SUCCESS: Minimal specific information found') print('📝 ASSESSMENT: The specific Archbishop information may not be readily available') print(' through standard web search methods.') print(f'\n🎯 ORIGINAL OBJECTIVE: Identify Archbishop who led Catholic Church disaster relief') print(f' efforts during the November 13, 1985 Nevado del Ruiz volcanic eruption in Colombia') print(f'📊 STATUS: Comprehensive web search completed - specialized archives may be needed')
Execution Output
Code Output: === COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF ALL ARCHBISHOP SEARCH DATA === Objective: Final analysis of all collected data for Archbishop identification Focus: Extract any available information about Colombian Catholic Church disaster response ================================================================================ 📁 TOTAL WORKSPACE FILES: 40 • JSON files: 37 • HTML files: 3 === STEP 1: COMPREHENSIVE JSON FILE ANALYSIS === 🔍 ANALYZING: archbishop_analysis_20250813_004111.json Keys: ['analysis_timestamp', 'task', 'data_sources_analyzed', 'archbishop_findings', 'Definition', 'DefinitionSource', 'DefinitionURL', 'Entity', 'Heading', 'Image', 'ImageHeight', 'ImageIsLogo', 'ImageWidth', 'Infobox', 'Redirect', 'RelatedTopics', 'Results', 'Type', 'meta'] 🔍 'AbstractSource', 'AbstractText', 'AbstractURL', 'Answer', 'AnswerType', 'Definition', 'DefinitionSource', 'DefinitionURL', 'Entity', 'Heading', 'Image', 'ImageHeight', 'ImageIsLogo', 'ImageWidth', 'Infobox', 'Redirect', 'RelatedTopics', 'Results', 'Type', 'meta'] 🔍 ANALYZING: duckduckgo_search_3.json Keys: ['Abstract', 'AbstractSource', 'AbstractText', 'AbstractURL', 'Answer', 'AnswerType', 'Definition', 'DefinitionSource', 'DefinitionURL', 'Entity', 'Heading', 'Image', 'ImageHeight', 'ImageIsLogo', 'ImageWidth', 'Infobox', 'Redirect', 'RelatedTopics', 'Results', 'Type', 'meta'] 🔍
