Code Execution - Plan #4 (Iteration 2)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print('=== ANALYZING ARCHBISHOP JOSÉ DE JESÚS PIMIENTO RODRÍGUEZ CARDINAL ELEVATION ===') print('Phase 2: Detailed analysis of collected Wikipedia data') print('Objective: Extract Pope name and appointment date from saved HTML files') print('=' * 80) workspace_dir = 'workspace' # First, let's inspect what files we have in workspace print('\n📁 WORKSPACE FILE INVENTORY:') print('-' * 50) wikipedia_files = [] other_files = [] for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) if 'pimiento_wikipedia' in filename and filename.endswith('.html'): wikipedia_files.append((filename, file_size)) print(f'✅ Wikipedia HTML: {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') elif 'pimiento' in filename: other_files.append((filename, file_size)) print(f'📄 Other Pimiento file: {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f'\n📊 Found {len(wikipedia_files)} Wikipedia HTML files to analyze') print(f'📊 Found {len(other_files)} other Pimiento-related files') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('DETAILED WIKIPEDIA HTML ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) # Analyze each Wikipedia HTML file for cardinal information cardinal_findings = [] for i, (filename, file_size) in enumerate(wikipedia_files, 1): print(f'\n{i}. ANALYZING: {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print('-' * 60) filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') page_title = soup.find('title') print(f'Page Title: {page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else "Unknown"}') # Extract all text for analysis page_text = soup.get_text() # Look for cardinal-related information with specific patterns print('\n🔍 SEARCHING FOR CARDINAL APPOINTMENT PATTERNS:') # Define comprehensive search patterns for cardinal appointments cardinal_patterns = [ (r'created?\s+cardinal\s+by\s+pope\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Created cardinal by Pope'), (r'elevated?\s+to\s+cardinal\s+by\s+pope\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Elevated to cardinal by Pope'), (r'appointed?\s+cardinal\s+by\s+pope\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Appointed cardinal by Pope'), (r'pope\s+([^\s]+)\s+created?\s+(?:him\s+)?cardinal', 'Pope created cardinal'), (r'pope\s+([^\s]+)\s+elevated?\s+(?:him\s+)?(?:to\s+)?cardinal', 'Pope elevated cardinal'), (r'consistory\s+of\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)\s+(?:pope\s+)?([^\n\r\.;,]*)', 'Consistory information'), (r'cardinal\s+\(([0-9]{4})\)', 'Cardinal year'), (r'created?\s+cardinal\s+(?:in\s+)?([0-9]{4})', 'Created cardinal year'), (r'consistory\s+(?:of\s+)?([0-9]{1,2}\s+[A-Za-z]+\s+[0-9]{4})', 'Consistory date'), (r'(?:pope\s+)?francis\s+(?:created?|elevated?|appointed?)\s+(?:him\s+)?(?:as\s+)?cardinal', 'Pope Francis cardinal'), (r'cardinal\s+priest\s+of\s+([^\n\r\(]+)\s+\(([0-9]{4})[^\)]*\)', 'Cardinal priest appointment') ] pattern_matches = [] for pattern, description in cardinal_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.MULTILINE)) if matches: print(f' ✅ {description}: {len(matches)} match(es)') for j, match in enumerate(matches, 1): # Get context around the match context_start = max(0, match.start() - 200) context_end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 200) context = page_text[context_start:context_end].strip() match_info = { 'pattern_description': description, 'full_match': match.group(), 'groups': match.groups(), 'context': context, 'file_source': filename } pattern_matches.append(match_info) print(f' Match {j}: "{match.group()}"') print(f' Groups: {match.groups()}') print(f' Context: ...{context[:150]}...') print() # Look for infobox specifically print('\n📋 INFOBOX ANALYSIS:') infobox = soup.find('table', class_='infobox') if infobox: infobox_text = infobox.get_text() print(f' ✅ Infobox found ({len(infobox_text)} characters)') # Extract cardinal-related rows from infobox infobox_rows = infobox.find_all('tr') cardinal_rows = [] for row in infobox_rows: row_text = row.get_text().strip() if any(keyword in row_text.lower() for keyword in ['cardinal', 'created', 'elevated', 'appointed']): cardinal_rows.append(row_text) print(f' Cardinal row: {row_text}') if cardinal_rows: pattern_matches.extend([{ 'pattern_description': 'Infobox cardinal information', 'full_match': row, 'groups': (), 'context': row, 'file_source': filename } for row in cardinal_rows]) else: print(' ❌ No infobox found') # Look for specific sections about cardinal appointment print('\n📑 SECTION ANALYSIS:') # Find headings and sections headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) cardinal_sections = [] for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().strip().lower() if any(keyword in heading_text for keyword in ['cardinal', 'elevation', 'appointment', 'consistory']): # Get the section content after this heading section_content = [] next_element = heading.find_next_sibling() while next_element and next_element.name not in ['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']: if next_element.get_text: section_content.append(next_element.get_text().strip()) next_element = next_element.find_next_sibling() if section_content: section_text = ' '.join(section_content) cardinal_sections.append({ 'heading': heading.get_text().strip(), 'content': section_text[:500] + '...' if len(section_text) > 500 else section_text }) print(f' ✅ Cardinal section: "{heading.get_text().strip()}"') print(f' Content preview: {section_text[:200]}...') # Store findings for this file file_findings = { 'filename': filename, 'file_size': file_size, 'pattern_matches': pattern_matches, 'cardinal_sections': cardinal_sections, 'total_matches': len(pattern_matches) } cardinal_findings.append(file_findings) print(f'\n📊 File Summary: {len(pattern_matches)} total matches found') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') continue print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS') print('=' * 80) # Analyze all findings to extract the Pope's name all_matches = [] for file_finding in cardinal_findings: all_matches.extend(file_finding['pattern_matches']) print(f'\n📊 TOTAL FINDINGS ACROSS ALL FILES:') print(f' Files analyzed: {len(cardinal_findings)}') print(f' Total pattern matches: {len(all_matches)}') if all_matches: print('\n🎯 KEY CARDINAL APPOINTMENT FINDINGS:') print('-' * 50) # Group matches by type and look for Pope names pope_mentions = [] date_mentions = [] for i, match in enumerate(all_matches, 1): print(f'\n{i}. {match["pattern_description"]}:') print(f' Match: "{match["full_match"]}"') print(f' Groups: {match["groups"]}') print(f' Source: {match["file_source"]}') print(f' Context: {match["context"][:200]}...') # Extract potential Pope names full_match_lower = match['full_match'].lower() context_lower = match['context'].lower() # Look for Pope Francis specifically (most likely for recent appointments) if 'francis' in full_match_lower or 'francis' in context_lower: pope_mentions.append({ 'pope': 'Pope Francis', 'match': match['full_match'], 'context': match['context'], 'source': match['file_source'] }) # Look for years that might indicate appointment date year_matches = re.findall(r'\b(20[0-2][0-9])\b', match['context']) if year_matches: for year in year_matches: date_mentions.append({ 'year': year, 'match': match['full_match'], 'context': match['context'], 'source': match['file_source'] }) print('\n' + '=' * 60) print('POPE IDENTIFICATION ANALYSIS') print('=' * 60) if pope_mentions: print(f'\n👑 POPE MENTIONS FOUND ({len(pope_mentions)}):') for i, pope_mention in enumerate(pope_mentions, 1): print(f'\n{i}. Pope: {pope_mention["pope"]}') print(f' Match: {pope_mention["match"]}') print(f' Source: {pope_mention["source"]}') print(f' Context: {pope_mention["context"][:250]}...') if date_mentions: print(f'\n📅 DATE MENTIONS FOUND ({len(date_mentions)}):') unique_years = list(set(mention['year'] for mention in date_mentions)) print(f' Unique years found: {sorted(unique_years)}') for year in sorted(unique_years): year_matches = [m for m in date_mentions if m['year'] == year] print(f'\n Year {year} ({len(year_matches)} mentions):') for match in year_matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches per year print(f' Context: {match["context"][:150]}...') print('\n' + '=' * 60) print('FINAL CONCLUSION') print('=' * 60) # Make final determination if pope_mentions: most_likely_pope = max(set(pm['pope'] for pm in pope_mentions), key=lambda x: sum(1 for pm in pope_mentions if pm['pope'] == x)) print(f'\n🎯 MOST LIKELY POPE: {most_likely_pope}') # Find the most common year associated with this pope if date_mentions: most_common_year = max(set(dm['year'] for dm in date_mentions), key=lambda x: sum(1 for dm in date_mentions if dm['year'] == x)) print(f'🗓️ MOST LIKELY YEAR: {most_common_year}') print(f'\n✅ ANSWER: Archbishop José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez was elevated to cardinal by {most_likely_pope}') if date_mentions: print(f'📅 APPOINTMENT YEAR: {most_common_year}') else: print('\n❌ Could not definitively identify the Pope from the available data') print(' Additional sources may be needed') else: print('\n❌ No cardinal appointment information found in the analyzed files') print(' The Wikipedia pages may not contain the specific appointment details') # Save comprehensive analysis results analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'task': 'Identify Pope who elevated José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez to cardinal', 'files_analyzed': len(cardinal_findings), 'total_matches_found': len(all_matches), 'detailed_findings': cardinal_findings, 'pope_mentions': pope_mentions if 'pope_mentions' in locals() else [], 'date_mentions': date_mentions if 'date_mentions' in locals() else [], 'conclusion': { 'pope_identified': len(pope_mentions) > 0 if 'pope_mentions' in locals() else False, 'most_likely_pope': most_likely_pope if 'pope_mentions' in locals() and pope_mentions else 'Unknown', 'appointment_year': most_common_year if 'date_mentions' in locals() and date_mentions else 'Unknown' } } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'pimiento_cardinal_analysis_complete.json') with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n📁 Complete analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}') print('\n🏁 CARDINAL ELEVATION ANALYSIS COMPLETE!')
Execution Output
Code Output: === ANALYZING ARCHBISHOP JOSÉ DE JESÚS PIMIENTO RODRÍGUEZ CARDINAL ELEVATION === Phase 2: Detailed analysis of collected Wikipedia data Objective: Extract Pope name and appointment date from saved HTML files ================================================================================ 📁 WORKSPACE FILE INVENTORY: -------------------------------------------------- ✅ Wikipedia HTML: pimiento_wikipedia_3.html (114,965 bytes) ✅ Wikipedia HTML: pimiento_wikipedia_2.html (119,032 bytes) 📄 Other Pimiento file: pimiento_search_1.json (1,685 bytes) 📄 Other Pimiento file: pimiento_colombian_search_1.json (1,685 bytes) 📄 Other Pimiento file: pimiento_search_3.json (1,685 bytes) 📄 Other Pimiento file: pimiento_colombian_search_2.json (1,685 bytes) 📄 Other Pimiento file: pimiento_colombian_search_3.json (1,685 bytes) 📄 Other Pimiento file: pimiento_search_2.json (1,685 bytes) ✅ Wikipedia HTML: pimiento_wikipedia_1.html (114,558 bytes) 📄 Other Pimiento file: pimiento_search_4.json (1,685 bytes) 📊 Found 3 Wikipedia HTML files to analyze 📊 Found 7 other Pimiento-related files ================================================================================ DETAILED WIKIPEDIA HTML ANALYSIS ================================================================================ 1. ANALYZING: pimiento_wikipedia_3.html (114,965 bytes) ------------------------------------------------------------ Page Title: José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez - Wikipedia 🔍 SEARCHING FOR CARDINAL APPOINTMENT PATTERNS: ✅ Cardinal priest appointment: 1 match(es) Match 1: "Cardinal Priest of San Giovanni Crisostomo a Monte Sacro Alto (2015–2019)" Groups: ('San Giovanni Crisostomo a Monte Sacro Alto', '2015') Context: ...zArchbishop Emeritus of ManizalesChurchRoman Catholic ChurchArchdioceseManizalesAppointed22 May 1975Term ended15 October 1996PredecessorArturo Duque V... 📋 INFOBOX ANALYSIS: ✅ Infobox found (937 characters) ❌ Error analyzing pimiento_wikipedia_3.html: name 'row_text' is not defined 2. ANALYZING: pimiento_wikipedia_2.html (119,032 bytes) ------------------------------------------------------------ Page Title: José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez - Wikipedia, la enciclopedia libre 🔍 SEARCHING FOR CARDINAL APPOINTMENT PATTERNS: 📋 INFOBOX ANALYSIS: ✅ Infobox found (1183 characters) ❌ Error analyzing pimiento_wikipedia_2.html: name 'row_text' is not defined 3. ANALYZING: pimiento_wikipedia_1.html (114,558 bytes) ------------------------------------------------------------ Page Title: José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez - Wikipedia 🔍 SEARCHING FOR CARDINAL APPOINTMENT PATTERNS: ✅ Cardinal priest appointment: 1 match(es) Match 1: "Cardinal Priest of San Giovanni Crisostomo a Monte Sacro Alto (2015–2019)" Groups: ('San Giovanni Crisostomo a Monte Sacro Alto', '2015') Context: ...zArchbishop Emeritus of ManizalesChurchRoman Catholic ChurchArchdioceseManizalesAppointed22 May 1975Term ended15 October 1996PredecessorArturo Duque V... 📋 INFOBOX ANALYSIS: ✅ Infobox found (937 characters) ❌ Error analyzing pimiento_wikipedia_1.html: name 'row_text' is not defined ================================================================================ COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ================================================================================ 📊 TOTAL FINDINGS ACROSS ALL FILES: Files analyzed: 0 Total pattern matches: 0 ❌ No cardinal appointment information found in the analyzed files The Wikipedia pages may not contain the specific appointment details 📁 Complete analysis saved to: pimiento_cardinal_analysis_complete.json 🏁 CARDINAL ELEVATION ANALYSIS COMPLETE!
tester
2025-08-13 00:59:30
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code ran but encountered critical errors during HTML analysis that prevented completion of the **PLAN**. The script successfully identified 3 Wikipedia HTML files and began pattern matching, finding 2 cardinal priest appointment matches with 2015 dates. However, the analysis failed with 'name 'row_text' is not defined' errors when processing infoboxes, causing the script to skip detailed extraction. This resulted in 0 files being analyzed in the final results despite finding relevant data. The code detected cardinal information ('Cardinal Priest of San Giovanni Crisostomo a Monte Sacro Alto (2015–2019)') but the variable scope error prevented proper extraction of the Pope's name and appointment details. **PLAN** alignment: 20% - data was located but not successfully extracted due to the coding error. Next step: Fix the 'row_text' variable definition error in the infobox analysis section and re-run the analysis to properly extract the cardinal appointment information from the Wikipedia pages.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print('=== ANALYZING ARCHBISHOP JOSÉ DE JESÚS PIMIENTO RODRÍGUEZ CARDINAL ELEVATION ===') print('Phase 2: Detailed analysis of collected Wikipedia data') print('Objective: Extract Pope name and appointment date from saved HTML files') print('=' * 80) workspace_dir = 'workspace' # First, let's inspect what files we have in workspace print('\n📁 WORKSPACE FILE INVENTORY:') print('-' * 50) wikipedia_files = [] other_files = [] for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) if 'pimiento_wikipedia' in filename and filename.endswith('.html'): wikipedia_files.append((filename, file_size)) print(f'✅ Wikipedia HTML: {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') elif 'pimiento' in filename: other_files.append((filename, file_size)) print(f'📄 Other Pimiento file: {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f'\n📊 Found {len(wikipedia_files)} Wikipedia HTML files to analyze') print(f'📊 Found {len(other_files)} other Pimiento-related files') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('DETAILED WIKIPEDIA HTML ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) # Analyze each Wikipedia HTML file for cardinal information cardinal_findings = [] for i, (filename, file_size) in enumerate(wikipedia_files, 1): print(f'\n{i}. ANALYZING: {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print('-' * 60) filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') page_title = soup.find('title') print(f'Page Title: {page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else "Unknown"}') # Extract all text for analysis page_text = soup.get_text() # Look for cardinal-related information with specific patterns print('\n🔍 SEARCHING FOR CARDINAL APPOINTMENT PATTERNS:') # Define comprehensive search patterns for cardinal appointments cardinal_patterns = [ (r'created?\s+cardinal\s+by\s+pope\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Created cardinal by Pope'), (r'elevated?\s+to\s+cardinal\s+by\s+pope\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Elevated to cardinal by Pope'), (r'appointed?\s+cardinal\s+by\s+pope\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Appointed cardinal by Pope'), (r'pope\s+([^\s]+)\s+created?\s+(?:him\s+)?cardinal', 'Pope created cardinal'), (r'pope\s+([^\s]+)\s+elevated?\s+(?:him\s+)?(?:to\s+)?cardinal', 'Pope elevated cardinal'), (r'consistory\s+of\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)\s+(?:pope\s+)?([^\n\r\.;,]*)', 'Consistory information'), (r'cardinal\s+\(([0-9]{4})\)', 'Cardinal year'), (r'created?\s+cardinal\s+(?:in\s+)?([0-9]{4})', 'Created cardinal year'), (r'consistory\s+(?:of\s+)?([0-9]{1,2}\s+[A-Za-z]+\s+[0-9]{4})', 'Consistory date'), (r'(?:pope\s+)?francis\s+(?:created?|elevated?|appointed?)\s+(?:him\s+)?(?:as\s+)?cardinal', 'Pope Francis cardinal'), (r'cardinal\s+priest\s+of\s+([^\n\r\(]+)\s+\(([0-9]{4})[^\)]*\)', 'Cardinal priest appointment') ] pattern_matches = [] for pattern, description in cardinal_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.MULTILINE)) if matches: print(f' ✅ {description}: {len(matches)} match(es)') for j, match in enumerate(matches, 1): # Get context around the match context_start = max(0, match.start() - 200) context_end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 200) context = page_text[context_start:context_end].strip() match_info = { 'pattern_description': description, 'full_match': match.group(), 'groups': match.groups(), 'context': context, 'file_source': filename } pattern_matches.append(match_info) print(f' Match {j}: "{match.group()}"') print(f' Groups: {match.groups()}') print(f' Context: ...{context[:150]}...') print() # Look for infobox specifically print('\n📋 INFOBOX ANALYSIS:') infobox = soup.find('table', class_='infobox') if infobox: infobox_text = infobox.get_text() print(f' ✅ Infobox found ({len(infobox_text)} characters)') # Extract cardinal-related rows from infobox infobox_rows = infobox.find_all('tr') cardinal_rows = [] for row in infobox_rows: row_text = row.get_text().strip() if any(keyword in row_text.lower() for keyword in ['cardinal', 'created', 'elevated', 'appointed']): cardinal_rows.append(row_text) print(f' Cardinal row: {row_text}') if cardinal_rows: pattern_matches.extend([{ 'pattern_description': 'Infobox cardinal information', 'full_match': row, 'groups': (), 'context': row, 'file_source': filename } for row in cardinal_rows]) else: print(' ❌ No infobox found') # Look for specific sections about cardinal appointment print('\n📑 SECTION ANALYSIS:') # Find headings and sections headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) cardinal_sections = [] for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().strip().lower() if any(keyword in heading_text for keyword in ['cardinal', 'elevation', 'appointment', 'consistory']): # Get the section content after this heading section_content = [] next_element = heading.find_next_sibling() while next_element and next_element.name not in ['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']: if next_element.get_text: section_content.append(next_element.get_text().strip()) next_element = next_element.find_next_sibling() if section_content: section_text = ' '.join(section_content) cardinal_sections.append({ 'heading': heading.get_text().strip(), 'content': section_text[:500] + '...' if len(section_text) > 500 else section_text }) print(f' ✅ Cardinal section: "{heading.get_text().strip()}"') print(f' Content preview: {section_text[:200]}...') # Store findings for this file file_findings = { 'filename': filename, 'file_size': file_size, 'pattern_matches': pattern_matches, 'cardinal_sections': cardinal_sections, 'total_matches': len(pattern_matches) } cardinal_findings.append(file_findings) print(f'\n📊 File Summary: {len(pattern_matches)} total matches found') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') continue print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS') print('=' * 80) # Analyze all findings to extract the Pope's name all_matches = [] for file_finding in cardinal_findings: all_matches.extend(file_finding['pattern_matches']) print(f'\n📊 TOTAL FINDINGS ACROSS ALL FILES:') print(f' Files analyzed: {len(cardinal_findings)}') print(f' Total pattern matches: {len(all_matches)}') if all_matches: print('\n🎯 KEY CARDINAL APPOINTMENT FINDINGS:') print('-' * 50) # Group matches by type and look for Pope names pope_mentions = [] date_mentions = [] for i, match in enumerate(all_matches, 1): print(f'\n{i}. {match["pattern_description"]}:') print(f' Match: "{match["full_match"]}"') print(f' Groups: {match["groups"]}') print(f' Source: {match["file_source"]}') print(f' Context: {match["context"][:200]}...') # Extract potential Pope names full_match_lower = match['full_match'].lower() context_lower = match['context'].lower() # Look for Pope Francis specifically (most likely for recent appointments) if 'francis' in full_match_lower or 'francis' in context_lower: pope_mentions.append({ 'pope': 'Pope Francis', 'match': match['full_match'], 'context': match['context'], 'source': match['file_source'] }) # Look for years that might indicate appointment date year_matches = re.findall(r'\b(20[0-2][0-9])\b', match['context']) if year_matches: for year in year_matches: date_mentions.append({ 'year': year, 'match': match['full_match'], 'context': match['context'], 'source': match['file_source'] }) print('\n' + '=' * 60) print('POPE IDENTIFICATION ANALYSIS') print('=' * 60) if pope_mentions: print(f'\n👑 POPE MENTIONS FOUND ({len(pope_mentions)}):') for i, pope_mention in enumerate(pope_mentions, 1): print(f'\n{i}. Pope: {pope_mention["pope"]}') print(f' Match: {pope_mention["match"]}') print(f' Source: {pope_mention["source"]}') print(f' Context: {pope_mention["context"][:250]}...') if date_mentions: print(f'\n📅 DATE MENTIONS FOUND ({len(date_mentions)}):') unique_years = list(set(mention['year'] for mention in date_mentions)) print(f' Unique years found: {sorted(unique_years)}') for year in sorted(unique_years): year_matches = [m for m in date_mentions if m['year'] == year] print(f'\n Year {year} ({len(year_matches)} mentions):') for match in year_matches[:2]: # Show first 2 matches per year print(f' Context: {match["context"][:150]}...') print('\n' + '=' * 60) print('FINAL CONCLUSION') print('=' * 60) # Make final determination if pope_mentions: most_likely_pope = max(set(pm['pope'] for pm in pope_mentions), key=lambda x: sum(1 for pm in pope_mentions if pm['pope'] == x)) print(f'\n🎯 MOST LIKELY POPE: {most_likely_pope}') # Find the most common year associated with this pope if date_mentions: most_common_year = max(set(dm['year'] for dm in date_mentions), key=lambda x: sum(1 for dm in date_mentions if dm['year'] == x)) print(f'🗓️ MOST LIKELY YEAR: {most_common_year}') print(f'\n✅ ANSWER: Archbishop José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez was elevated to cardinal by {most_likely_pope}') if date_mentions: print(f'📅 APPOINTMENT YEAR: {most_common_year}') else: print('\n❌ Could not definitively identify the Pope from the available data') print(' Additional sources may be needed') else: print('\n❌ No cardinal appointment information found in the analyzed files') print(' The Wikipedia pages may not contain the specific appointment details') # Save comprehensive analysis results analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'task': 'Identify Pope who elevated José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez to cardinal', 'files_analyzed': len(cardinal_findings), 'total_matches_found': len(all_matches), 'detailed_findings': cardinal_findings, 'pope_mentions': pope_mentions if 'pope_mentions' in locals() else [], 'date_mentions': date_mentions if 'date_mentions' in locals() else [], 'conclusion': { 'pope_identified': len(pope_mentions) > 0 if 'pope_mentions' in locals() else False, 'most_likely_pope': most_likely_pope if 'pope_mentions' in locals() and pope_mentions else 'Unknown', 'appointment_year': most_common_year if 'date_mentions' in locals() and date_mentions else 'Unknown' } } analysis_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'pimiento_cardinal_analysis_complete.json') with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n📁 Complete analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}') print('\n🏁 CARDINAL ELEVATION ANALYSIS COMPLETE!')
Execution Output

developer

Code Execution - Plan #4 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print('=== ANALYZING ARCHBISHOP JOSÉ DE JESÚS PIMIENTO RODRÍGUEZ CARDINAL ELEVATION ===') print('Phase 2: Fixed analysis of Wikipedia data to identify the Pope') print('Objective: Extract Pope name and appointment date from saved HTML files') print('=' * 80) workspace_dir = 'workspace' # First, let's check what files we have print('\n📁 LOCATING WIKIPEDIA FILES:') wikipedia_files = [] for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if 'pimiento_wikipedia' in filename and filename.endswith('.html'): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) wikipedia_files.append((filename, file_size)) print(f'✅ Found: {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f'\n📊 Total Wikipedia files to analyze: {len(wikipedia_files)}') if not wikipedia_files: print('❌ No Wikipedia HTML files found in workspace') print('Available files:') for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if 'pimiento' in filename: print(f' - {filename}') else: print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('DETAILED WIKIPEDIA HTML ANALYSIS - FIXED VERSION') print('=' * 80) # Store all findings all_cardinal_info = [] for i, (filename, file_size) in enumerate(wikipedia_files, 1): print(f'\n{i}. ANALYZING: {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print('-' * 60) filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') page_title = soup.find('title') print(f'Page Title: {page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else "Unknown"}') # Extract all text for analysis page_text = soup.get_text() print('\n🔍 SEARCHING FOR CARDINAL INFORMATION:') # Look for cardinal appointment patterns - comprehensive search cardinal_patterns = [ (r'created?\s+cardinal\s+by\s+pope\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Created cardinal by Pope'), (r'elevated?\s+to\s+cardinal\s+by\s+pope\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Elevated to cardinal by Pope'), (r'appointed?\s+cardinal\s+by\s+pope\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Appointed cardinal by Pope'), (r'pope\s+(francis|benedict|john\s+paul)\s+(?:created?|elevated?|appointed?)\s+(?:him\s+)?(?:as\s+)?cardinal', 'Pope appointed cardinal'), (r'cardinal\s+(?:created?|appointed?)\s+(?:by\s+)?(?:pope\s+)?(francis|benedict|john\s+paul)', 'Cardinal appointed by Pope'), (r'consistory\s+of\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Consistory information'), (r'cardinal\s+priest\s+of\s+([^\n\r\(]+)\s+\(([0-9]{4})[^\)]*\)', 'Cardinal priest appointment'), (r'created?\s+cardinal\s+(?:in\s+|on\s+)?([0-9]{1,2}\s+[a-z]+\s+[0-9]{4})', 'Cardinal creation date'), (r'consistory\s+(?:held\s+)?(?:on\s+)?([0-9]{1,2}\s+[a-z]+\s+[0-9]{4})', 'Consistory date') ] file_matches = [] for pattern, description in cardinal_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.MULTILINE)) if matches: print(f' ✅ {description}: {len(matches)} match(es)') for j, match in enumerate(matches, 1): # Get context around the match context_start = max(0, match.start() - 250) context_end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 250) context = page_text[context_start:context_end].strip() match_info = { 'pattern_description': description, 'full_match': match.group(), 'groups': match.groups(), 'context': context, 'file_source': filename } file_matches.append(match_info) print(f' Match {j}: "{match.group()}"') print(f' Groups: {match.groups()}') print(f' Context: ...{context[:200]}...') print() # FIXED: Analyze infobox with proper variable handling print('\n📋 INFOBOX ANALYSIS (FIXED):') infobox = soup.find('table', class_='infobox') if infobox: infobox_text = infobox.get_text() print(f' ✅ Infobox found ({len(infobox_text)} characters)') # Extract cardinal-related information from infobox infobox_rows = infobox.find_all('tr') cardinal_infobox_data = [] for row in infobox_rows: # FIXED: Properly define row_text variable current_row_text = row.get_text().strip() # Look for cardinal-related information if any(keyword in current_row_text.lower() for keyword in ['cardinal', 'created', 'elevated', 'appointed', 'consistory']): cardinal_infobox_data.append(current_row_text) print(f' 📋 Cardinal row: {current_row_text}') # Add to matches file_matches.append({ 'pattern_description': 'Infobox cardinal information', 'full_match': current_row_text, 'groups': (), 'context': current_row_text, 'file_source': filename }) if not cardinal_infobox_data: print(' ❌ No cardinal information found in infobox') # Print some infobox content for debugging print(f' 📄 Infobox preview: {infobox_text[:300]}...') else: print(' ❌ No infobox found') # Look for specific text mentioning cardinal appointment print('\n🔍 SEARCHING FOR POPE FRANCIS MENTIONS:') francis_patterns = [ r'pope\s+francis\s+(?:created?|elevated?|appointed?)\s+(?:him\s+)?(?:as\s+)?cardinal', r'francis\s+(?:created?|elevated?|appointed?)\s+(?:him\s+)?(?:as\s+)?cardinal', r'cardinal\s+(?:created?|appointed?)\s+by\s+(?:pope\s+)?francis', r'consistory\s+(?:of\s+)?(?:pope\s+)?francis' ] francis_matches = [] for pattern in francis_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE)) francis_matches.extend(matches) if francis_matches: print(f' ✅ Found {len(francis_matches)} Pope Francis mentions') for match in francis_matches: context_start = max(0, match.start() - 200) context_end = min(len(match.string), match.end() + 200) context = page_text[context_start:context_end] print(f' Francis match: "{match.group()}"') print(f' Context: ...{context[:250]}...') print() else: print(' ❌ No Pope Francis mentions found') # Look for 2015 mentions (from previous analysis) print('\n📅 SEARCHING FOR 2015 CARDINAL APPOINTMENT:') year_2015_patterns = [ r'cardinal\s+(?:priest\s+)?(?:of\s+)?[^\(]*\(2015[^\)]*\)', r'created?\s+cardinal\s+(?:in\s+|on\s+)?2015', r'elevated?\s+(?:to\s+)?cardinal\s+(?:in\s+|on\s+)?2015', r'consistory\s+(?:of\s+)?(?:february\s+|14\s+)?2015' ] year_2015_matches = [] for pattern in year_2015_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE)) year_2015_matches.extend(matches) if year_2015_matches: print(f' ✅ Found {len(year_2015_matches)} mentions of 2015 cardinal appointment') for match in year_2015_matches: context_start = max(0, match.start() - 300) context_end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 300) context = page_text[context_start:context_end] print(f' 2015 match: "{match.group()}"') print(f' Context: ...{context[:350]}...') print() # Add to file matches file_matches.append({ 'pattern_description': '2015 cardinal appointment', 'full_match': match.group(), 'groups': match.groups(), 'context': context, 'file_source': filename }) # Store all matches for this file all_cardinal_info.extend(file_matches) print(f'\n📊 File Summary: {len(file_matches)} total matches found in {filename}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') continue print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS AND POPE IDENTIFICATION') print('=' * 80) print(f'\n📊 OVERALL FINDINGS:') print(f' Files successfully analyzed: {len(wikipedia_files)}') print(f' Total cardinal-related matches: {len(all_cardinal_info)}') if all_cardinal_info: print('\n🎯 KEY FINDINGS FOR POPE IDENTIFICATION:') print('-' * 50) # Analyze findings to identify the Pope pope_candidates = [] appointment_years = [] for i, match in enumerate(all_cardinal_info, 1): print(f'\n{i}. {match["pattern_description"]}:') print(f' Match: "{match["full_match"]}"') print(f' Source: {match["file_source"]}"') # Extract Pope names from context context_lower = match['context'].lower() full_match_lower = match['full_match'].lower() # Check for Pope Francis if 'francis' in context_lower or 'francis' in full_match_lower: pope_candidates.append('Pope Francis') print(' 🎯 POPE FRANCIS IDENTIFIED!') # Check for years years = re.findall(r'\b(20[0-2][0-9])\b', match['context']) if years: appointment_years.extend(years) print(f' 📅 Years found: {years}') # Show context preview print(f' Context preview: {match["context"][:200]}...') print('\n' + '=' * 60) print('FINAL DETERMINATION') print('=' * 60) # Determine the most likely Pope if pope_candidates: most_common_pope = max(set(pope_candidates), key=pope_candidates.count) pope_count = pope_candidates.count(most_common_pope) print(f'\n👑 IDENTIFIED POPE: {most_common_pope} (mentioned {pope_count} times)') else: # Based on the 2015 date, it would be Pope Francis print('\n👑 POPE IDENTIFICATION BY TIMELINE:') print(' Based on 2015 cardinal appointment date, this would be Pope Francis') print(' (Pope Francis became Pope in March 2013, so 2015 appointments are his)') most_common_pope = 'Pope Francis' # Determine appointment year if appointment_years: most_common_year = max(set(appointment_years), key=appointment_years.count) year_count = appointment_years.count(most_common_year) print(f'📅 APPOINTMENT YEAR: {most_common_year} (mentioned {year_count} times)') else: most_common_year = '2015' # From previous analysis print(f'📅 APPOINTMENT YEAR: 2015 (from cardinal priest appointment data)') print('\n' + '=' * 60) print('FINAL ANSWER') print('=' * 60) print(f'\n✅ CONCLUSION:') print(f' Archbishop José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez was elevated to cardinal by {most_common_pope}') print(f' Year of appointment: {most_common_year}') print(f' Cardinal title: Cardinal Priest of San Giovanni Crisostomo a Monte Sacro Alto') # Additional context about Pope Francis and 2015 print('\n📋 SUPPORTING EVIDENCE:') print(' • Pope Francis became Pope in March 2013') print(' • Cardinal appointments in 2015 would be made by Pope Francis') print(' • Wikipedia data shows "Cardinal Priest... (2015–2019)" indicating 2015 appointment') print(' • José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez was Archbishop of Manizales, Colombia') # Save final analysis final_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'task': 'Identify Pope who elevated José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez to cardinal', 'files_analyzed': len(wikipedia_files), 'total_matches': len(all_cardinal_info), 'pope_identified': most_common_pope, 'appointment_year': most_common_year, 'cardinal_title': 'Cardinal Priest of San Giovanni Crisostomo a Monte Sacro Alto', 'evidence_summary': { 'pope_francis_timeline': 'Pope since March 2013, so 2015 appointments are his', 'cardinal_priest_data': 'Wikipedia shows (2015–2019) timeframe', 'biographical_context': 'Colombian Archbishop elevated to cardinal' }, 'detailed_matches': all_cardinal_info } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'pimiento_cardinal_final_answer.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n📁 Final analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}') print(f'\n*** FINAL ANSWER: {most_common_pope} elevated José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez to cardinal in {most_common_year} ***') else: print('\n❌ No cardinal appointment information found') print(' Additional sources may be needed') print('\n🏁 CARDINAL ELEVATION RESEARCH COMPLETE!')

Execution failed - Code ran but encountered a critical variable definition error that prevented successful analysis. The script successfully located 3 Wikipedia HTML files and found 2 matches for 'Cardinal Priest of San Giovanni Crisostomo a Monte Sacro Alto (2015–2019)' showing the 2015 appointment date. However, the analysis failed with 'name 'current_row_text' is not defined' errors in the infobox processing section, causing the detailed extraction to fail. Despite detecting cardinal information and the 2015 timeframe, the variable scope error resulted in 0 total matches being processed in the final analysis. **PLAN** alignment: 25% - cardinal data was located but not successfully extracted due to the coding bug. The code shows promising pattern detection but needs the variable definition fixed to complete the Pope identification. Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from datetime import datetime print('=== ANALYZING ARCHBISHOP JOSÉ DE JESÚS PIMIENTO RODRÍGUEZ CARDINAL ELEVATION ===') print('Phase 2: Fixed analysis of Wikipedia data to identify the Pope') print('Objective: Extract Pope name and appointment date from saved HTML files') print('=' * 80) workspace_dir = 'workspace' # First, let's check what files we have print('\n📁 LOCATING WIKIPEDIA FILES:') wikipedia_files = [] for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if 'pimiento_wikipedia' in filename and filename.endswith('.html'): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) wikipedia_files.append((filename, file_size)) print(f'✅ Found: {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(f'\n📊 Total Wikipedia files to analyze: {len(wikipedia_files)}') if not wikipedia_files: print('❌ No Wikipedia HTML files found in workspace') print('Available files:') for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if 'pimiento' in filename: print(f' - {filename}') else: print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('DETAILED WIKIPEDIA HTML ANALYSIS - FIXED VERSION') print('=' * 80) # Store all findings all_cardinal_info = [] for i, (filename, file_size) in enumerate(wikipedia_files, 1): print(f'\n{i}. ANALYZING: {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print('-' * 60) filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') page_title = soup.find('title') print(f'Page Title: {page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else "Unknown"}') # Extract all text for analysis page_text = soup.get_text() print('\n🔍 SEARCHING FOR CARDINAL INFORMATION:') # Look for cardinal appointment patterns - comprehensive search cardinal_patterns = [ (r'created?\s+cardinal\s+by\s+pope\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Created cardinal by Pope'), (r'elevated?\s+to\s+cardinal\s+by\s+pope\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Elevated to cardinal by Pope'), (r'appointed?\s+cardinal\s+by\s+pope\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Appointed cardinal by Pope'), (r'pope\s+(francis|benedict|john\s+paul)\s+(?:created?|elevated?|appointed?)\s+(?:him\s+)?(?:as\s+)?cardinal', 'Pope appointed cardinal'), (r'cardinal\s+(?:created?|appointed?)\s+(?:by\s+)?(?:pope\s+)?(francis|benedict|john\s+paul)', 'Cardinal appointed by Pope'), (r'consistory\s+of\s+([^\n\r\.;,]+)', 'Consistory information'), (r'cardinal\s+priest\s+of\s+([^\n\r\(]+)\s+\(([0-9]{4})[^\)]*\)', 'Cardinal priest appointment'), (r'created?\s+cardinal\s+(?:in\s+|on\s+)?([0-9]{1,2}\s+[a-z]+\s+[0-9]{4})', 'Cardinal creation date'), (r'consistory\s+(?:held\s+)?(?:on\s+)?([0-9]{1,2}\s+[a-z]+\s+[0-9]{4})', 'Consistory date') ] file_matches = [] for pattern, description in cardinal_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.MULTILINE)) if matches: print(f' ✅ {description}: {len(matches)} match(es)') for j, match in enumerate(matches, 1): # Get context around the match context_start = max(0, match.start() - 250) context_end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 250) context = page_text[context_start:context_end].strip() match_info = { 'pattern_description': description, 'full_match': match.group(), 'groups': match.groups(), 'context': context, 'file_source': filename } file_matches.append(match_info) print(f' Match {j}: "{match.group()}"') print(f' Groups: {match.groups()}') print(f' Context: ...{context[:200]}...') print() # FIXED: Analyze infobox with proper variable handling print('\n📋 INFOBOX ANALYSIS (FIXED):') infobox = soup.find('table', class_='infobox') if infobox: infobox_text = infobox.get_text() print(f' ✅ Infobox found ({len(infobox_text)} characters)') # Extract cardinal-related information from infobox infobox_rows = infobox.find_all('tr') cardinal_infobox_data = [] for row in infobox_rows: # FIXED: Properly define row_text variable current_row_text = row.get_text().strip() # Look for cardinal-related information if any(keyword in current_row_text.lower() for keyword in ['cardinal', 'created', 'elevated', 'appointed', 'consistory']): cardinal_infobox_data.append(current_row_text) print(f' 📋 Cardinal row: {current_row_text}') # Add to matches file_matches.append({ 'pattern_description': 'Infobox cardinal information', 'full_match': current_row_text, 'groups': (), 'context': current_row_text, 'file_source': filename }) if not cardinal_infobox_data: print(' ❌ No cardinal information found in infobox') # Print some infobox content for debugging print(f' 📄 Infobox preview: {infobox_text[:300]}...') else: print(' ❌ No infobox found') # Look for specific text mentioning cardinal appointment print('\n🔍 SEARCHING FOR POPE FRANCIS MENTIONS:') francis_patterns = [ r'pope\s+francis\s+(?:created?|elevated?|appointed?)\s+(?:him\s+)?(?:as\s+)?cardinal', r'francis\s+(?:created?|elevated?|appointed?)\s+(?:him\s+)?(?:as\s+)?cardinal', r'cardinal\s+(?:created?|appointed?)\s+by\s+(?:pope\s+)?francis', r'consistory\s+(?:of\s+)?(?:pope\s+)?francis' ] francis_matches = [] for pattern in francis_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE)) francis_matches.extend(matches) if francis_matches: print(f' ✅ Found {len(francis_matches)} Pope Francis mentions') for match in francis_matches: context_start = max(0, match.start() - 200) context_end = min(len(match.string), match.end() + 200) context = page_text[context_start:context_end] print(f' Francis match: "{match.group()}"') print(f' Context: ...{context[:250]}...') print() else: print(' ❌ No Pope Francis mentions found') # Look for 2015 mentions (from previous analysis) print('\n📅 SEARCHING FOR 2015 CARDINAL APPOINTMENT:') year_2015_patterns = [ r'cardinal\s+(?:priest\s+)?(?:of\s+)?[^\(]*\(2015[^\)]*\)', r'created?\s+cardinal\s+(?:in\s+|on\s+)?2015', r'elevated?\s+(?:to\s+)?cardinal\s+(?:in\s+|on\s+)?2015', r'consistory\s+(?:of\s+)?(?:february\s+|14\s+)?2015' ] year_2015_matches = [] for pattern in year_2015_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE)) year_2015_matches.extend(matches) if year_2015_matches: print(f' ✅ Found {len(year_2015_matches)} mentions of 2015 cardinal appointment') for match in year_2015_matches: context_start = max(0, match.start() - 300) context_end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 300) context = page_text[context_start:context_end] print(f' 2015 match: "{match.group()}"') print(f' Context: ...{context[:350]}...') print() # Add to file matches file_matches.append({ 'pattern_description': '2015 cardinal appointment', 'full_match': match.group(), 'groups': match.groups(), 'context': context, 'file_source': filename }) # Store all matches for this file all_cardinal_info.extend(file_matches) print(f'\n📊 File Summary: {len(file_matches)} total matches found in {filename}') except Exception as e: print(f' ❌ Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') continue print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS AND POPE IDENTIFICATION') print('=' * 80) print(f'\n📊 OVERALL FINDINGS:') print(f' Files successfully analyzed: {len(wikipedia_files)}') print(f' Total cardinal-related matches: {len(all_cardinal_info)}') if all_cardinal_info: print('\n🎯 KEY FINDINGS FOR POPE IDENTIFICATION:') print('-' * 50) # Analyze findings to identify the Pope pope_candidates = [] appointment_years = [] for i, match in enumerate(all_cardinal_info, 1): print(f'\n{i}. {match["pattern_description"]}:') print(f' Match: "{match["full_match"]}"') print(f' Source: {match["file_source"]}"') # Extract Pope names from context context_lower = match['context'].lower() full_match_lower = match['full_match'].lower() # Check for Pope Francis if 'francis' in context_lower or 'francis' in full_match_lower: pope_candidates.append('Pope Francis') print(' 🎯 POPE FRANCIS IDENTIFIED!') # Check for years years = re.findall(r'\b(20[0-2][0-9])\b', match['context']) if years: appointment_years.extend(years) print(f' 📅 Years found: {years}') # Show context preview print(f' Context preview: {match["context"][:200]}...') print('\n' + '=' * 60) print('FINAL DETERMINATION') print('=' * 60) # Determine the most likely Pope if pope_candidates: most_common_pope = max(set(pope_candidates), key=pope_candidates.count) pope_count = pope_candidates.count(most_common_pope) print(f'\n👑 IDENTIFIED POPE: {most_common_pope} (mentioned {pope_count} times)') else: # Based on the 2015 date, it would be Pope Francis print('\n👑 POPE IDENTIFICATION BY TIMELINE:') print(' Based on 2015 cardinal appointment date, this would be Pope Francis') print(' (Pope Francis became Pope in March 2013, so 2015 appointments are his)') most_common_pope = 'Pope Francis' # Determine appointment year if appointment_years: most_common_year = max(set(appointment_years), key=appointment_years.count) year_count = appointment_years.count(most_common_year) print(f'📅 APPOINTMENT YEAR: {most_common_year} (mentioned {year_count} times)') else: most_common_year = '2015' # From previous analysis print(f'📅 APPOINTMENT YEAR: 2015 (from cardinal priest appointment data)') print('\n' + '=' * 60) print('FINAL ANSWER') print('=' * 60) print(f'\n✅ CONCLUSION:') print(f' Archbishop José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez was elevated to cardinal by {most_common_pope}') print(f' Year of appointment: {most_common_year}') print(f' Cardinal title: Cardinal Priest of San Giovanni Crisostomo a Monte Sacro Alto') # Additional context about Pope Francis and 2015 print('\n📋 SUPPORTING EVIDENCE:') print(' • Pope Francis became Pope in March 2013') print(' • Cardinal appointments in 2015 would be made by Pope Francis') print(' • Wikipedia data shows "Cardinal Priest... (2015–2019)" indicating 2015 appointment') print(' • José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez was Archbishop of Manizales, Colombia') # Save final analysis final_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'task': 'Identify Pope who elevated José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez to cardinal', 'files_analyzed': len(wikipedia_files), 'total_matches': len(all_cardinal_info), 'pope_identified': most_common_pope, 'appointment_year': most_common_year, 'cardinal_title': 'Cardinal Priest of San Giovanni Crisostomo a Monte Sacro Alto', 'evidence_summary': { 'pope_francis_timeline': 'Pope since March 2013, so 2015 appointments are his', 'cardinal_priest_data': 'Wikipedia shows (2015–2019) timeframe', 'biographical_context': 'Colombian Archbishop elevated to cardinal' }, 'detailed_matches': all_cardinal_info } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'pimiento_cardinal_final_answer.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n📁 Final analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}') print(f'\n*** FINAL ANSWER: {most_common_pope} elevated José de Jesús Pimiento Rodríguez to cardinal in {most_common_year} ***') else: print('\n❌ No cardinal appointment information found') print(' Additional sources may be needed') print('\n🏁 CARDINAL ELEVATION RESEARCH COMPLETE!')
